Had a large party. 15 people. Very accommodating. Great food. Great service. Good prices.
This place is great!  Huge portions, great service and awesome food.  The decor has a little to be desired here but who gives a flying F when the food is this good?  Awesome lunch specials too.

Came in during my lunch hour and it was very fast and it was very delicious. My friend asked for freshly made guacamole and to my surprise they actually make the guacamole right in front of you. It was very delicious as well. I had a chile relleno which did not disappoint me at all. It was a great atmosphere, great experience, and most of all great food. Will definitely go there again!

Nice atmosphere and great service.  They had live music for Mother's Day which added to the experience.  Even though the restaurant was very busy, all the staff seemed to be in a great mood.  I came here expecting a great experience all together, but I can't say I did and it's only because of the fish I got.  The drink I got was a bit strong as well, but I'm not one to complain about that!  I do hope to return and give this place a second chance because I do like the Michoacán in Centennial Hills.

Just don't get the garlic fish.
This is by far my favorite Mexican place in Vegas. Perhaps the entire west coast. Authentic feel from the ambience to the servers. Dishes are large and full of maximum flavor.

This is a great place for lunch.  You can have a ten minute or sixty minute lunch, up to you - the staff will meet you half way on whatever YOU WANT.  Be sure to ask for Violetta, she gives the best service and is so pleasant, you'll want to come every day.  Ask for a bowl of the special picante sauce that they make daily and be sure to get the guacamole made table side.  Other than that, get what  you are hankering for because all of the food is good.  Don't miss this place - can't beat the price/quality mix!  ENJOY!

My fiancé and I stopped by here while in Vegas. It was delicious food with a unique taste. I ordered the enchiladas michoacanas and they were delicious, the taste was very homey and authentic. My fiancé ordered the veggie enchiladas and he loved them. The servers were attentive, helpful, and had great energy. We'll be back the next time we're in Vegas!

The food is good, not excellent, but good. Customer service is what can take a restaurant to another level but they lack that here. 

Not friendly, no eye contact, they don't smile and seemed annoyed being asked for normal requests. We politely asked for more chips and for our drinks to be filled. They brought more chips but didn't bring more salsa or beans for the chips?  

They forgot about our fideo soup and asked us if we ever got it and we told them we never did. They ended up bringing the fideo soup out with our meal.  It became uncomfortable asking for service from waiters or waitresses that simply don't want to be there or help you.  Like I said, the food is good but don't expect great customer service here.

GREAT SERVICE!!!!
GREAT FOOD!!!
GREAT PEOPLE!!!

It's a must stop for us when we visit to Vegas. We usually take a taxi to and from our hotel/casino...this time when our server called on a taxi, they said it would be an hour wait for pick up...the lady at the counter offered to give us a ride back to our hotel/casino.  FYI we offered $$ to kind lady for the ride and she refused to take our money....THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR THE RIDE!!!

Ok this is a nice place... The food was good, I like the flavor of the fajitas better at other places but the tortillas were good. The guacamole my daughter said wasn't as good as a few other places as too chunky for her.... I like how they had basic options like chicken fingers for kids meals though. The mole poblano got good reviews at the table and some shrimp and cheese dish was big stars. The salsa had a nice kick. 
The waiters were great.. Very attentive, and we were celebrating so they came and sang happy birthday (comic relief as maybe they sing that no matter the occasion as wasn't a birthday and they knew that lol) they put candles in the cupcakes they let us bring in and they offered to dance with the kids to the live music. 
They let you watch the tortillas being made and overall a positive fun experience....other places I would go depending on what wanted but if the group wanted to go there I wouldn't protest
這家餐廳是道地的墨西哥食物，裡面的裝潢非常墨西哥式，我本人非常喜歡，偶而還有墨西哥樂團來唱歌，就好像在墨西哥一樣。而且收費也不是很貴，算是物廉價美的一家餐廳，如果你喜歡墨西哥食物，你可以來嚐嚐看！

We loved this place!!  The service was spectacular!  The food was unique and delicious. They still had traditional items but some very creative dishes as well including beef tongue.  
Maybe it's because we have been mostly eating on the strip where service is wakeful and the food is way over priced and bland. But this place with its festive decor and very very friendly and attentive staff really made our night! 
We come to Vegas often and plan on making it a regular stop'

This place is a very good Mexican Restaurant. The people here are very friendly and welcoming. I usually do work birthday parties here at this location. I always reserve a spot for 15-20 people at lunchtime and they never say no!! When its your bday they bring out a big Mexican hat and make you wear and sing Happy bday to you in Spanish. Then they bring out a nice complimentary desert. I recommend this place to anyone that craves Mexican Food!!

It really is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is quaint, the service is friendly, and the food is phenomenal.Been searching for the best Mexican spot and I think we found it... the food had large portions and the live band was cool.. The pricing is affordable and although our waiter was useless the bus boy was great.. we are new yorkers so we know good service.. TABLESIDE GUACAMOLE IS THE BEST!!! & peach margaritas come with real peach slices, it's the best snack place!! Fish tacos weren't life changing though.Tableside guacamole that is so good. Ceviche was one of the best I have had. I thought the food was all good. Equivalent to lindo michoacan. The service was friendly.Bonito Michoacan really is a diamond in the rough out here on The West Side. It may not seem special on the outside, but the food inside is worth the drive.The enchiladas here actually do have taste. The chile relleno is also a good choice. I could even tell the salsa was homemade.It's good Mexican comfort food here, and the food shouldn't be disappointing.great mexican place good service, homemade tortillas, freh table side guacamole, good music, good margatitas! I am very pickey when it comes to Mexican food due to being of Mexican decent and enjoy finding the "real thing". Bonito Michoacan is The Real Thing.....love the food, atmosphere and the people. It's a great place to eat or just go and have their delicious margaritas.

Fun!
The experience is fun, yummy margaritas.
The food isn't anything that I haven't had before. I ordered one of he combinations, it was tasty but nothing crazy different from other Mexican restaurants I've been to.
I'll be back though, it was a lot of fun and looks like a cool place for birthdays.
Waiter had an attitude, used the check in for the margarita . Oh well keep it professional and ate our food. The attitudes not necessary. Food was great
The food is great!!! Too bad that's the only good thing about it. Customer service is BAD and with an ATTITUDE. They take too long to bring you the food but it comes with the check.

Okay Yelp, you did me wrong on this one.  This is the absolute worst Mexican food that I have ever tasted.  First of all the food is not flavorful, I had to put salt on everything from the salsa to the beans and every item on my plate.  I ordered a combo plate with a chile relleno, chicken enchilada and chicken taco.  The chicken did not have any flavor and was very dry.  The chile relleno was full of water and the sauce on it tastes like pure tomato sauce.  Overall, it was a horrible meal.  The best part about my dinner was the tableside guacamole which of course needed salt and the wait staff who were very attentive.

Found this place on accident while in Vegas! Great place! Great decor! Great food! Great service! Very authentic. Will be returning in my next visit to Vegas. I would have posted photos BUT we ate it all.
Really good service and nice people. Really good food. Especially the fresh made guacamole and menudo. I would definitely recommend it. I would come back whenever I come back to Vegas.

This is probably my favorite Mexican restaurant.  We come here often for lunch and some Birthdays. We always sit in Violeta's section and she has it together. She knows what we want without us ordering!  Margaritas and food magically appear!  The chips and salsa are delicious as is the fresh table side guacamole!  Well worth a trip!!

Can't give lower or I would...1:00 lunch on Saturday...crowded, with a couple of big parties of 10+...My wife and I getting a couple of burritos, maybe $18.00 w/$4.00 tip...got the chips and dips, with soup to start...and that was it...chips gone, soup gone and an hour later, we were gone...nobody came to our table for an hour...our waiter was next to us, behind us, but never said a word about where our burritos were...no refills, no water, nothing...at least the gal taking pictures didn't stop and try to get us buy pictures for $10 a piece...pretty intrusive....stay away unless you want to get free chips, dips and soup and then eat your entrée somewhere else

Wow!!! This place was a treat, I have no complaints service was friendly quick and hospitable. I was surprised when they welcomed us to our table with complimentary soup salsa n bean dip. But what really made this a great experience was the shrimp plate, I have never experienced a taste like that. I'll be back soon!

Even better food than the Lindo location in Henderson just without the view.  

Consistently good food and lively atmosphere.  Our server Mimi was awesome.  She was engaging, funny and took great care of us.  We will ask for her next time we go here.  

The food is super fresh, well prepared and plenty of it.  The tortillas are amazing and we can't get enough of them.  This is my favorite place when I want Mexican food.
came in to vegas for vacation, i ask a local were to go for good mariscos. he was dead on this place was great.  good food good service great beer
Excellent guac, and the shrimp and avocado salad was delicious. Very busy with locals for lunch.
Good authentic food with reasonable price. They have exceptional service with live band... I will definitely come back here with my fam... Have to try their fresh  guacamole made to order...

I visited this place yesterday afternoon with a friend. I hadn't been in years, but thought I remembered it under a different name years ago?? Anyway, decor, service and food did not disappoint. The restaurant has a very authentic feel and I love the decorations. Our server and other staff were very pleasant during our dining experience; chips and salsa and drinks never went empty. We both ordered combination plate entrees--mine was a pork guacamole burrito (excellent), a cheese enchilada, and a chicken taco. We also enjoyed the house margaritas which are offered through check in. They were so good, we opted for one more :) I would definitely recommend this place for people looking for good, authentic Mexican cuisine.
I prefer New Mexico mexican food but Bonito Michoacan has some very good dishes.  The carnitas are very good, as is the mole enchiladas.  The gratis chips, salsa and beans is a nice touch too.

I am seriously torn.  When it come to Chinese and Mexican food, I think there is a fine line between value, and rip off.  I mean if I'm eating a perfectly delicious taco for $3, how much better will it get for 6-8x the price.  I understand that at a restaurant there are other amenities, advantages, and portions are bigger, but on flavor and experience alone, is the mark up really worth it?  This place serves delicious Mexican food.  I have no complaints, service was professional, and friendly.  There is nothing wrong with this establishment.  I just feel that I would hit up one of my favorite no frills taco joints before returning here.

Love the ambiance but i think it was the ambiance that made the food taste good.  Food was on the bland side.   I got the steak fajita and i prefer the steak fajita served at Chilis. It was very bland and steak was over cooked. I mean overcooked to well done and i don't believe anybody should eat steak well done.  I will definitely be back for the ambiance and hope that the next dish I order isn't like the fajita.

I love the authenticity of the decor and cuisine. I celebrated my birthday there. It was a blast. The salsa and chips were savory and spicy and had you wanting more. The portion sizes was pretty plentiful I left with a to go bag. The waiter we had reminded us of a family member serving Sunday dinner he was laughing and joking and also very friendly. I had the "combancion mary y tierra" (Grilled steak and shrimp) which was DELICIOUS.... It was an enjoyable experience. I truly recommend for authentic Mexican and a good time....Try this place...

This is my favorite place to get Mexican food. I live in Salt Lake City and make it a point to come here at least once every time I come to Vegas. The guacamole is awesome, they make it fresh at your table.
Such amazing food! I'm a sucker for Mexican food and this didn't disappoint! The service was phenomenal and very attentive!

Came here to celebrate my Dads birthday and we absolutely loved it! The food was great and the service was exceptional! Thank you Bonito Michoacan for making our celebration a little more special there's nothing better than going to a restaurant and getting great service and great food! We will def be back!

Went to dinner here last night for my birthday. We had previously eaten here in May, 2013. That time we enjoyed the meal very much and planned on going back again for a special occasion. This time in no way resembled the previous experience. I had the # 1 combination of chile rellenos, chicken enchilada, and a beef taco. The rellenos was covered in some generic tomato sauce and was bland tasting. The cheese was very stringy and tasteless. The enchilada was so-so and the beef taco was almost Inedible. Beef was dry and the taco shell was hard as a rock. My date had a green chile burrito that had big chunks of pork instead of shredded, the chicken taco also had big chunks of chicken instead of shredded, and her cheese enchilada was basically a tortilla rolled up with sauce and cheese on top. She didn't care for any of it. She also ordered sopapillas to be served with our meal, and they showed up 15 minutes after the entree. When we asked where they were the waitress said they were "cooking them fresh".The bean dip was also bland and the chips were stale. Being a Specialty Room Chef in Las Vegas for over 20 years, I know good food. My hunch is that management has sourced cheaper product to cut cost and the quality dropped immensely, or the kitchen staff totally changed and doesn't produce the same quality as the staff from last year's visit. Lastly the table in our booth wobbled and we felt like we were sitting way to low, with the table height up to chest level because of the worn out seating. Also the music could drop a few decibels. It's not a nightclub. Needless to say I would never go back. Chipotle or even Taco Bell would be a preferred dining choice.

Good, solid food- a cross between Tex-Mex and authentic Mexican, definitely a place that caters to both American and Mexican tastes- the menu is HUGE! Chips and salsa are outstanding as is the guacamole. I had enchiladas and they were awesome, beans and rice typical. 

Vibe is great and waitstaff are wonderful. I will definitely be back!

What can I say? Girlfriend wanted to go to a Mexican restaurant and heard some good reviews from some of my coworkers at work so I decided to give it a shot. Immediately we were greeted at the door and a booth was found for the two of us. We ordered our drinks, and then chips and bean dip and salsa (which we did not both particularly care for) sat in front of us. The fideo soup was simply amazing, and was complementary as well. She ordered the carnitas plate with beans and rice and guacamole. 10/10 for that. I ordered the Pollo Al Cognac. 10/10 has well. The carnitas was better in my opinion, but both dishes were extremely flavorful. We took our dessert home with us since after the beans, fideo soup, and our meal we were absolutely stuffed. I ordered the cheesecake burrito and she ordered flan. She said the Flan was good. I personally do not care for flan at all, so I did not try it.

Food - 10/10
Service - 8/10 (merely for the fact they sat the menu down in front of us and literally 20 seconds later asked us what we wanted. Made me feel slightly rushed)
Atmosphere - 9/10 (the live music was a tad bit loud and sometimes I could not hear by date while she was talking to me)

I would definitely recommend this place to anybody looking for a good Mexican restaurant with decent prices and huge portion sizes.
I love this place I come here often and they never disappoint me  food is always fresh and yummy I get the same thing every time lol

We came for the Preparados - also referred to as Michelada - so yummy and refreshing when you feel a little crappy after too many drinks the night before. They're very satisfying here. 
I also got the cactus appetizer which was super juicy and fresh, very large portion, too. My friend got the steak with rice and beans and the steak was super flavorful and tender. 
The beans they serve have so much flavor and I ate them w chips over the salsa because the salsa gave me a crazy cough attack (I think a little bit of pepper was stuck in my throat) which was embarrassing and something I didn't want to happen again lol
Also, the service was really good. We were laughing because I would ask for something and they would bring it two seconds later. We started to think they could read our minds!

Coming from a native San Diegan who has been exposed to GOOD Mexican food her entire life THIS PLACE IS LEGIT! Their menu had a good variety of dishes and the service was absolutely great! Boyfriend had the steak in cilantro & lime and I had the tamal plate. Everything was fresh and delicious! Will definitely be back!
Consistently delicious! Great lunch specials and good service. Love the sopa de fidelo soup it's sooo good!
Great food and great service, parking is tight and come prepared to wait.

Pros:
-Service was excellent. The servers were very polite and our food came out fast. We had about 3 people constantly filling our drinks/chips/salsa/beans. Plus, they're really good at singing happy birthday :)
-My fiance loves beans and was really excited to see they served complimentary beans with their chips and salsa. A nice touch and one I have never seen before in a Mexican restaurant

Cons:
-The food was OK. I got #16 (two hard chicken tacos, all rice) and I enjoyed it, although the tacos were a little small. My fiance had a combo plate as well (hard beef taco and enchilada, all beans) and did not like the enchilada's red sauce.

All in all, the restaurant was alright and if I was in town again I might consider coming back.
Great service, great guacamole, generous Margaritas, and all around very good food.  It's the tastiest Mexican food in town and the best service too.

Their ceviche was good, but their margaritas were even better. What I loved most about this place wasn't the food, it was the service. The waiters are incredibly friendly and helpful. They make sure you enjoy your visit there.
If you go there, be prepared to eat!  The food there is delicious, and the service fantastic.  We brought our daughter for her birthday meal here, and they could not have been more gracious.

I have been there 10 plus times now and still have never had a meal that wasn't outstanding.  Best authentic Mexican I have ever had and I travel the us for a living.  Just ask the server Richard for his favorite and you will never be disappointed.
Not really much to say.... Really good food excellent customer service and one if the best wetback burrito spots in town

The margaritas are good.... not too sweet, but not trying to drown the sweetness with too much liquor. The food took a little long, but they were busy for a Monday I thought. Once the food came out, it was easily worth the wait. I had the mojara which is a pretty traditional dish that is replicated a lot in Mexican restaurants, but is a hit or miss. It was crunchy on the outside, moist in the inside. The waitress was friendly and efficient. This location is a gem outside of the strip and I would highly recommend it.
Great spot. Love the fideo soup they bring out and the tableside guac. Good atmosphere. Friendly staff. Would definitely recommend.

OMG the best, freshest truly truly authentic Mexican food this side of the border.  The pina coladas were to die for; to die for.  The ceviche was HUGE and out of this world fresh.  Real fresh fish!  I had to leave a little to make room for the Mole Poblano which was amazing.  My husband had fish tacos and I never heard him surface for air the entire meal.  The staff is super cool, too.  Beautiful atmosphere, super authentic.  The bathrooms are so cute!!  Super clean, too.  Will most definitely go to again and again!!!

I had a Groupon for Bonito Michoacan.  I was seated in the bar area and the bartender was my server.  She brought me chips, salsa, and bean dip quickly along with my iced tea.  She passed the empty sweetener bag test with flying colors!

First. my dinner came with fideo soup.  It was very good with less of a tomato taste than I'm used to getting.  There was more of a chicken stock flavor.  For the main course, I ordered the Enchiladas de Mole con Pollo, two cheese enchiladas heated in a red mole sauce with a chicken breast, refried beans, rice, and some lettuce shreds and a dollop of sour cream.  The mole tasted a bit sweet at first but then I got the undertones of the other spices and the richness of the mole came out.  The chicken breast was good.  It was seasoned in any manner so I gave it a good shower of Tapatio.

For dessert, I got the fried ice cream.  I guess fried ice cream is just something that comes out of the freezer.  I don't think anyone "breads" and fries the ice cream in real time anymore.

I was very pleased with my visit.  I was of two minds about where I was seated.  Two men were having a loud discussion (argument?) about politics in Spanish and the one had enough tecate to not know how loudly he was talking.  However, I could have been sitting in another part of the restaurant where there was a crying baby.  I think it was better where I was.  

This was an enjoyable dinner!

This is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas it's a tradition to go eat when we visit absolutely amazing. I love the sopa aguada that they give you as a starter you must have have their refried   beans.Customer service is absolutely great always cheerful and very pleasant I don't think I will ever stop coming to this place... it's a bit far from the strip but the drive is worth it never had a bad experience  nor bad food and for that I will continue  to return!!!!!
Hostess and Server were awesome, gave suggestions and the Cilantro steak was so delicious! We asked him to customize and it was perfectly cooked and amazing. Best place for real Mexican food!

Pretty good place... just not into the clown decor there. 

One remarkable thing is that their hand made tortillas are AMAZING!!! Especially, the flour ones... mmm mmm mmm... make sure you work out before you eat there because you will gain a good amount there.

Definitely the best Mexican Food in Vegas.  Their salsa is fresh and delicious.  Ask for the verde if you want to kick it up a notch.

All of their dishes are good, but I have fallen in love with the pollo sarandeado.

Where should I start? This place has great Mexican food for Las Vegas! The bean dip compliments the chips very well. My boyfriend and I visited this place mid November and we didn't know what we wanted to eat for breakfast. It was already passed 10am when we realized that McDonald's would stop serving breakfast at 10:30am! I decided to google some Mexican restaurants and voila'! This place is close to the Las Vegas new strip. I had the machacado plate and he had the chorizo with cheese plate. Everything was great, the customer service and the price. I will definitively be coming back here every chance I can when in town. I am from Texas and it's sad to say the food here is better than some back home. Now, you know! When in Las Vegas stop by here for Authentic Mexican Food....Only a 10 minute drive from the (new) strip.

When you come to Mexican Food, I always tell people to go to this place. Great interior and exterior color such as authentic mexican feel you were in mexico. I cant say anything bad about this place little bit of louder music who playing the keyboard in the corner. May be that's a part of mexican lol. ANyway, The very first thing you try is the Fresh Guacamole  they made in front of you and give with home made chips and the mouth watering beans ad salsa. They have a biggest verity of any mexican restaurant in the town... Their Number of stake is right on the money and their other plates are also huge.  Also, The soup they gave you before the meal is make a great appetite.  

Finally, they have great magaritas and great seafood if you love to be drunk and a islander....
Our first time here.  Loved the bean dip and salsa.  Our meals were better yet.  Recommend the Camarones Saranadeados ... Delicious.

This place is a hidden jewel to all the tourist. 
if you are looking for a tradtional authentic mexican restaurant then this is the place. the owner came from Michoacan, Mexico and they know how to cook.

from homemade tortillas to everything on the menu. You can not go wrong with nothing on this menu.
they even bring you chips, homemade beans, and salsa in the beginning.

i would recommend this to anyone. Great food, Great service, and TRUE mexican food.

This has always been my favorite Mexican restaurant especially for lunch. For over two years I've ordered lunch  here... never a problem. But today we ordered the green chili burritos there was literally about three chunks of meat in it along with a spoonful of beans and it was the flattest burrito I've ever seen. There was a spoonful of beans on the side and a fair portion of rice. Typically when we order and pick up we get the lunch special which includes one order of being dip and chips and a drink. Today there were  no chips ...just a container of salsa. I know sometimes things happen I hope this is just a rare occasion!  we'll give it one more shot but we were really disappointed. I hope this isn't another case of great restaurant gone bad.

The food is on on point!  I ordered the carne asada and it was a full strip steak.  I loved it.  She had the cilantro chicken and it was great.  The chips and salsa with beans are some of the best in town.  Will definitely be back.  Great filling lunch specials too.

Came here on a groupon. Had bacon wrapped shrimp. good flavors, but the shrimp was over done. Typical beans and rice. Nothing special. The food did come to the table hot. Nothing really stands out about this place.

Bonito Michoacan is simply the best. We come here every time we come here everytime we come to visit from California. Everything is absoultely delicious and we bring everyone here everytime we come. Homemade fresh delicious taste this restaraunt can not be beat. It is the best mexican food in all of Las Vegas Nevada.

We live near this restaurant which appears to always be hopping and very popular.
I truly appreciated the welcoming and very attentive staff. Margaritas were good. My husband had camarones rancheros which come in a red sauce with beans and rice as well as a soup. I had flavorful camarones borrachas which were better- buttery garlic sauce with red pepper flakes.
We had very nice coffee and split a flan. 
I thought at around $18 the entrees were overpriced.
Portions are not overwhelmingly huge which is good.
A good solid family place- not Wow but Good.

Came here at 1pm for lunch and they are packed! We waited for 5 mins and got a table by the window, yayy love it! At first they served us the chips, salsa and bean. The salsa kinda disappointed me because its plain, tasted like chilli oil without flavor. But that's not a big deal because it's free lol can't complain about it. I ordered the New York steak Carna Asada. It was very good.  Will def come back!

Delicious, mouth watering fajitas. Outstanding service and even better margarita's. I'm a Mexican food consumer and have eaten at many authentic places from Las Vegas all the way to mexico. So far this is good in Vegas!

We met a local friend here at his invitation, and it did not disappoint.  

Curb appeal is inviting and parking ample.  We were seated immediately and our very gregarious, personable waiter took excellent care of us from beginning to end.  

The margaritas had plenty of authority; the warm chips and salsa delicious.  Apparently, every entree includes a small cup of chicken-broth-style soup, which had a nice flavor.  We didn't see our favorite thing on the menu--a fajita combo of steak, chicken, and shrimp--but we asked and they gladly made it for us.  It was perfect, with just the right amount of char, served on a sizzling platter.  The rice was flavored superbly and the guacamole fresh and creamy.  

My only complaint is the lighting:  It glares just a bit, and could be solved easily and inexpensively with dimmer switches.

I think you'll notice in many of the reviews you see comments on how exceptional the service is at this location and I completely agree! Our server, Richard, was totally awesome and boosted this from a 4 star to a 5 star review. He was super friendly, helpful, attentive and made some bad-ass guacamole! The food was delicious and very authentic according to my latin boyfriend. The homemade tortillas were sooo good, the steak & chicken fajitas very tasty also. We had a great time and will definitely be back for more.

This place has the best food out of all their restaurants! Delicious drinks! 
The atmosphere is so live with music, the best service, & very colorful! They all make you feel so welcomed. Juan is my absolute favorite server! He just lights up your day as soon as you see him, he's always happy & always makes you laugh! Their birthday surprises are the best! Definitely must try!!

Pros: good mole sauce
Attentive staff above average food
They bring out complimentary bean dip

Cons: busy on weekends

Mexican food is a weakness of mine, especially since I'm supposed to et right for my blood type. However occasionally I will splurge and this is where I go! 

Now the food is always excellent and I enjoy the atmosphere and even though the prices are still higher than I think they should be its a good stop to fulfill the craving. 

I recently went to eat here with my husband,friend and little boy. The food came out hot and quick and they didn't miss a beat with filling our drinks. So they have great service. The only thing i wasn't found of is that the music was soooooo loud I couldn't hear my friend across the table. But that's really an observation rather than a complaint! 

I will I back again and bring friends.

I first became a fan of sister restaurant Lindo Michoacan on Desert Inn but Bonito is much closer to my home.  

We are "regulars" there so it's nice to walk in and have the waiter or waitress know your order.  

Try the table side guacamole.  It's the best guacamole I've EVER had. And if you can, try to sit in Violeta's section.  She makes it even better than the other waiters. However, Juan and Jose (I think that's his name) are good waiters too.  

The veggies in the fajitas are so fresh and delicious but you can't really go wrong with anything you order here.
Busy cozy colorful place with great Mexican food at a reasonable price. Lots of  blue collar workers have lunch here. They know good food.

We just had a fantastic experience here.  OUT_SSSTANDING.  The food was excellent, fresh guac prepared table-side, excellent salsas, chips fresh from the oil, great portions, super service, super prices...

The food was delicious, fresh, our server Julio was superb...the hostesses were smiling and really friendly.  No visit to LV will be complete in the future without a trip to this place.  It was that good.

Fan-friggin-tastic. get the chicken they recommend - it's a mind blower! Menu is insanely difficult to navigate so I just asked for a recommendation and poof, it was killer good. The best Mexican food I have ever eaten.

Prices are higher now but the quality of the food is still superb. I love the seafood cocktail and the fillet relleno(don't think I spelled it right.) It's very delicious and highly recommended. Food is 5 star. One star removal for the prices but I always go. Lol.
Love the atmosphere! The waters are so upbeat and fun and the food is really good! They also have a great view of all the pretty lights from the strip. Careful though they really like to up sell.

My experience here with my family was outstanding. Our waiter was hilarious and he really took care of us. All of our food was SO flavorful and obviously cooked with care. I'm writing this review two years after the fact, so I know that I am leaving out some parts of our experience here, but all I can remember is how delicious and wonderful everything was. Go here, please.

Yum!!! I love that they serve beans with the tortilla chips. If you order a combination meal they serve fideo soup with it which is tasty! I like to order the #5 Santa Clara (enchilada, tostada and taco) with rice and beans which don't disappoint. I like the huevos rancheros too. Friendly service and fun atmosphere! The mariachi band is great!

Truly awful.  If I had not eaten here, I would not have believed it was possible to mess up Mexican food this badly.  By comparison, Taco Bell gets at least two Michelin stars.

Ambiance - A cut or two below Denny's, with Mexican colors.  The best I can say is that I didn't actually see any cockroaches.  There was some noise, which I assume was intended as music, but which sounded more like drunk UNLV students celebrating a basketball victory.

Service - Quick and disinterested.  In fact, quick is an understatement.  The food appeared within less than a minute, and was obviously pre-cooked and sitting under a heat lamp in the kitchen.

Food - Awful, awful, and more awful.  The tortilla chips were not fresh.  The guacamole had so much lime juice that it was nearly inedible (and I LOVE guacamole).  The soup tasted like equal parts dishwater and vinegar, with a thimbleful of ramen noodles thrown in.  My beef burrito had chunks of beef (God, I HOPE it was beef) that appeared to be boiled soup meat, although the tortilla was fresh.  Even the rice and beans tasted acidic.  The portions were small (no Woody Allen jokes here, please), and the prices (by Mexican restaurant standards) were no bargain.  Don't get me wrong - $8 for the guacamole and $10.50 for each Margarita is not ridiculous in and of itself, but by the time the check came I was thinking they should have paid me to eat here.
Great authentic mexican food and environment. I have never been let down by the food and you can't beat their chips with bean dip and free Margarita with each check in.

I went the other day for lunch with a friend and was pleasantly surprised. The restaurant is very authentic with hand painted chairs and decor. I liked the chill atmosphere. I had the lunch special beef fajitas and LOVED them. They didn't get served on a sizzling plate, but they were scrumptious all the same. I also really liked the complimentary chips, bean dip and salsa. I will totally be making a return.

Searching desperately for a Mexican restaurant that stayed open a little later than 9pm on the night of my friend's dad's birthday, we settled on Bonito Michoacan.

What we received was extremely friendly service, a lot of delicious food, and they had like a 4 piece band sing happy birthday and gave our man of the hour a free shot of tequila.

I don't really see anything I could have criticized from our experience. We were seated promptly, treated well, and the food was surprisingly very delicious. Additionally, we stayed there for a good 40 minutes after their closing time and never felt rushed at all.

I had the steak cilantro, whilst the others around the table had an assortment of chimichanga, a crazy gigantic burrito, and chicken helena or something along those lines. Everything was cooked really well with rich strong flavors.

We also got the hand-made table side guacamole and it was extremely tasty and fresh.

All in all it was a very pleasant experience.

People, if you are in Vegas for a few days, hire a car and get off the strip.  The restaurants are 100 times better off the strip.  I have to confess:  I have never been a fan of Mexican food until I discovered this place and Lindo Michoacan - also in Vegas city.  Admittedly, the only Mexican food I've had has been in Toronto and ... well, need I say more.  Everything at this place is good.  They even prepared (complimentary) table side guac. for us.  OMG the freshness of the ingredients is unsurpassed.  They have traditional Mexican food like pozole (one of my favourites) and chicken with wine and prunes.  I salivate just thinking about the place.  Spouse loves the chicken verde as well.  The freshness of the ingredients ... tomatillos that were not out of a can ... indescribable.  The refried beans is like silk going down.  One of my all time favourite restaurants ever.  The owners are truly nice guys who really make one feel at home.  Go there.  Tell them I sent you.

Great Mexican food off of the strip. It's a short cab ride and was recommended to me by a local. There are a lot menu items to choose from, even some that are very traditional Mexican. 

I had the Carne Asada which was very tasty, cooked perfectly and with the homemade tortillas were fantastic.

Nora, the bartender, had great service and made a really good margarita. 

I would recommend this place to anyone in the Vegas area.

Not sure what experience former reviewers have with Mexican food but don't believe the positive reviews. This place was awful. Carnitas are stiff and smell like old feet, bland chicken tacos, bland enchiladas. Only positives were the shrimp which were decent at best and the homemade tortillas but what good is a tortilla if there's nothing tasty to put in it. 

If you're from la or sf skip and save your Mexican for cali. If you're from Vegas go anywhere else. There's no way it can be worse than this.

We were so surprised at how excellent this restaurant was. We had no idea. The food and service were impeccable. We had taken guests out to a well known steak house the night before and the food here was 100 times better than the fancy steak house. The service was much better too. The food we all had was great, the atmosphere was perfect and the music was very enjoyable. We have found one of our new favorite Mexican restaurants and the prices were great too and offer such value for the high quality food you get.

This place is just eh...
Edible I suppose....
Seems like their food always takes so long just to come out warm.
The chips and salsa are ok. 
The service is never great but ok. Like most Mexican restaurants they just take your order, bring your food and your bill....
I only eat here when I'm invited to join someone, never by choice.
I called all over Las Vegas and this is the only place I found so far that makes homemade flour and corn tortillas so it's definitely worth a stop.

Found out about this place via Yelp while out in Vegas with my whole family. So happy I did! From the moment we walked in to the time we left, everything was great!!! To start off, the waitress was super attentive and friendly. 
We all got the menudo... Yummy! My sister had some type of mango margarita with chamoy that was refreshing and delicious. My dad had a michelada and swore it was one of the best. 
It's a bit of a drive from the strip but it's worth it! 
We will definitely be going back when on Vegas!

This is a place that my friends from California really like to go to.  The service is quite excellent where when you get chips you get salsa as well as bean dip.  When ordering food I suggest you get the Flour tortillas to be used because they taste so much better than the corn ones where the nachos are very delicious where they don't skip out on anything in it.  I ordered the Flautas (which are nicer taquitos) and it was really really good.

Absolutely one of the 2 worst Mexican restaurants I've been to ever.  I thought maybe b/c it's in Vegas and not southern CA? It starts out with soup that tasted like freeze-dried Lipton noodle soup. None of the 3 of us ate it. We took our waiter's recommendations, and although he was efficient, he was not right.  We ordered from the Specialities, and 1/3 was good: the camarones a la cognac. Booths were too short for the table. The live music-1 guy- was okay for free, but sang American songs, which did not contribute to the Mexican atmosphere. Subsequently, 2 of us went to El Nopal restaurant in Vegas, which was excellent, and proves Vegas does have good Mexican restaurants!

There are lots of things to do in Las Vegas, but there is only 1 thing that is mandatory on our list: dinner at Bonito Michoacan. For me it's all about the carnitas. My wife it's all about the handmade flour tortillas. A trip to Vegas hasn't even begun until we've had our fix. We just love, love, love it.

Everything about this place was amazing!

Food selection and quality, service, bustling vibe, etc. Experience here will be something you never expected from a Mexican restaurant.

Tacos de Camarones (deep fried shrimp tacos) was super tasty.

Parking lot is huge, but it's always packed. You'll see why, on your first visit.

I gave up on Mexican places to eat here in Vegas. Even this place at first. But then was reintroduced to this place and it soon became the only place i'd go for Mexican food. Food is always on point here. Fun atmosphere and the best margaritas!!! Love the staff they are awesome and so is their table side guac making skills!
Excellent chips and salsa Verde! Great device and they have a vegetarian fajitas which were very yummy!

Great food. Great service. Our waiter Julio was excellent. Definitely coming back. I have to say that the seafood was very fresh. My wife love this place just as much as I did. We can't stop talking about the food.

One of our favorite Mexican places in town. The handmade guac at the table is delicious, entree portion size leaves you full and the Margarita's are tasty. Good service and very good family crowd. Lots of creepy clown type figurines prevents the 5 star review...

My wife and I went here last night.  We had a shrimp dish and the carne asada.  The steak tasted salty which was weird.  The shrimp was a little too chewy.  Not great overall.  The service was good, lots of helpful guys.  The reason for only two stars was the after-affect the next morning of Montezumas revenge for both of us.  That was an experience we could have had at a roadside taco shop.  No amount of free alcohol would make me 'Vote Benito'  Thanks.

I went to Vegas on a family trip, we stumbled upon this restaurant since we wanted authentic Mexican food and it really did not disappoint. We were greeted right away by the host and seated maybe about 5min after. They accommodated our group of 8 right away. The décor is so cute and fun. Our waiter was very helpful and friendly. They bring you a fresh fideo soup for the whole table and it is warm and delicious. The Micheladas are so good and big! They have all these different types of drinks with fun names! The food is very delicious and flavorful, I ordered the carne asada, so juicy and full of flavor. I asked for the Carne Asada medium done and it was exactly how I wanted it. Everyone at the table was very satisfied and happy we came across this restaurant the service was great, food was definitely authentic, I will be coming back whenever I'm in town. 

Also they take these cute pictures of your whole table that you can purchase afterwards!

We are in Las Vegas for a convention and wanted out of the hotel for dinner, the bell desk recommended this restruant. Six of us went,  we all ordered different items and drinks.  All were pleased with their meals.  The chips, salsa, bean dip along the the guacamole, made at table side were great.  

Pricing was reasonable.  I would return if in town again.
We stopped by here on vacation. The food was great, service was great and the environment was great. It's well worth a stop.
Just fulfilled my craving for Huevos Rancheros. Great place. Beautiful friendly Hostess and great server. Of course I will return.

Great service and food as always. Can't go to Vegas without stopping here to recover after a long night. I had the Pollo Del Res. The veggies were so fresh with tender shredded white meat chicken. The tortillas both corn and flour are made fresh. I highly recommend!

This place is delicious!!!  The atmosphere is very traditional and expected. The food was amazing. Had the tamal and enchilada and it was amazing!!  The wait staff was pretty quick. Our waiter was a bit inattentive but I won't hold it against the restaurant.  Definitely worth checking out!!  Next time trying the mangoneada and tamarind ma

Went here for the first time. Food was average for las vegas mexican food, no better. I will say the menu was huge, so there could be plenty of things that are great, just don't know after one visit. The facility itself is in need of repair. It is a little on the old side and looks it inside. As for the employees, our waiter was 'Lorenzo', and if you are looking for the one single employee who has no personality, as in zero, this is you man. Holy smoke. Drove out of our way to get there, not again.

had my 36th birthday here with a party of about 10. They were very accomodating and the food was excellent.  It is not cheap but the everything was very well cooked and about half our party were natives of Michoacan so they are very very fussy about their Mexican food.  Everyone loved it. My 3 old loved the clown motif although that may not be for everyone.  The margaritas were sassy!  Great job :)

Service was good, food was okay I'd give it 3. Stars for food and 4 for service. The guacamole was really good- got some fresh homemade tortillas to go with it. I got a veggie burrito and I heard the chicken enchiladas were okay.

Great service, friendly staff. The food is so delicious!! I Highly recommend this restaurant. It was our first time being here and We fell in love with it! We are most definitely returning when we are in town.
Have eaten at several Mexican food places in vegas great price.. excellent service excellent food..

I really like the food here.  My standard is the Tacos con Carne Asada.  It;s very similar to Tacos al Carbon which is grilled meat, with rice & beans.  

I also like the bean dip and salsa they provide for free. Refills are no problem and the service when I've there (3 times) has been quick and friendly.  

The last two times there was a guy on an electric keyboard playing which was (ahem) interesting.  Depends on your musical taste, but played a lot of cheesy 70's toons.  Overall solid choice for Mexican, I'll be back.

With a gluten free intolerance, I usually avoid Mexican restaurants, but our group of 6 heard fantastic recommendations for this place, so I went along with a positive mindset and was pleasantly surprised. Our server was not only knowledgeable of gluten, but told me with confidence exactly what menu items were safe. It seems the make all tortillas, chips, etc fresh in their restaurant and possibly the dressings as well. 

With a gf peace of mind, I enjoyed a beautiful spinach mango artichoke salad with sliced jicama and raspberry vinaigrette. The best, the BEST salad Ive ever had. That say a lot for a salad!!!

All of the five gentlemen in my group greatly enjoyed their meals as well, from the guacamole made table-side to the fajitas and other authentic dishes. Delicious, delicious food with knowledgeable servers in an authentic and clean environment. Check it out!!!

Food is delicious so tasty awesome service Eduardo our server was so nice and friendly I will definetly be coming back to this place. The ambiance is good not a long wait and great decor I'm glad I found this place while visiting from la

This is easily my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.  The chips and salsa are great.....both are home made and the salsa is very spicy.....just the way I like it.  It is not for the weak.

My favorite dishes are:
Queso Fundido w/Chorizo - Basically a cheese appetizer with chorizo served on a hot fajita plate.  Comes with flour or corn tortillas....this is very good.  I order this when I take friends to this restaurant for the 1st time and every one of them agree with me.

Carne Asada Burrito - Very tasty, good quality Carne Asada.

Inside their menu, they have a lot of dishes to choose from....not to mention an extensive combo menu where there are a lot of combo dishes.....I have tried at least 7 or 8 different combos...all are very good.

We go to this restaurant at least 1 to 2 times per month for lunch at work and 1 time per month for dinner.  The prices are very reasonable too.
Tortillas hechas a mano! Excelente service and the food is is delicious. .. great find. We came for breakfast and will be coming back for dinner.

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant that reminds me of the authentic Mexican food found in So Cal! Great prices, free chips and salsa and bean dip, I love the deep fried taco combination and the fried ice cream! Every time I go to Vegas, I have to eat here! Very fun atmosphere and lots of singing for bdays also which makes this place extra fun!

Excellent service!
Violetta section the best !
Excellent food , great place to enjoy family
Quesadillas and ceviche here are yummy!  Our server was really friendly and seemed to love working here.

This place is awesome! I can't complain about a single thing! The food is great! The people are great and its always fun! Ask for Juan as your waiter and I promise he will make your visit worth your while! We had our wedding rehearsal dinner there and it was amazing! Go there once and you will go there again for sure.

I got to give 5 stars on my 1st visit on Septemeber 2016 on our vegas trip to celebrate my daugther bday the food was excellent and the service from a wonderful lady was just amazing give her 10 stars not sure what her name was they take cute pictures and the happy bday song and the sombrero was just amazing so we where happy to have come across a real mexican place in Vegas so we decided to come once again in Nov on thanksgiving weekend they server was man with horrible service we had drinks and coronas and ask for Lemon he came back saying they where out of Lemons like really how can a mexican place the sells tacos be out of Lemons so a few minutes later we see him on a another table making guacamole and he is using LEMONS!!!!!  Ok whatever i decided to stay quiet and not say anything he will take for ever to come to our table to check up on us or for refills he was just horrible the guys cleaning up the tables where more helpfull they have funny names on their food and its a cute place and our server did not even brough us the fideo soup i had to ask for it in the end and he only came with one he was just horrible

The happy hour here is awesome!  Great preparadas and margaritas.  The street tacos and the ceviche tostadas are bomb!!  The bartenders are all pretty hot too!  Very welcoming and give great customer service.

I have been on the search for a great Mexican restaurant ever since I moved back here a few months ago & THIS IS IT! I feel like I am in Mexico every time I go. The atmosphere is great. The staff are friendly. The place is clean. The location, super easy to find. Good parking spots. 

Firstly, the chips & salsa they serve when you first sit down are delicious. They also serve BEAN DIP! We always get the guacamole as well & it is made table side! Be careful not to eat too much & stuff yourself before you even order, like I always do. 

The menu is so big, it always takes me a while to decide. They have a combination menu for people like me who can't decide on what to get. Last time I got the beef taco & cheese enchilada combination, which is served with rice and beans. 

They also have a great desert menu! I forgot what the name was, but we ordered the Fried ice cream with bananas around it. It was delicious! Also, their margaritas are exceptionally good. 

Definitely going here any time I want good Mexican food in Las Vegas.
The atmosphere, staff, and food are all wonderful. The waiter we had, unfortunately we forgot his name, but he was the best. The cilantro steak was amazing. It's a little pricey but worth it.

Never been disappointed at this spot. When we are craving Mexican food these guys are on point.  Live music tonight and everyone is in a great mood.  Servers are fast and polite even singing along in some instances
The food is good and portion size satisfies.  No problem with substitutions or extras.  
Free margarita with Yelp check in is a nice touch as well.  Good place, good food, good times

I sure like this place.  It's the "go-to" Mexican restaurant for meeting friends in Las Vegas.  I've been four times.  It's been excellent every time.

Service is outstanding.  Quick friendly seating, attentive waitstaff, and an eagerness to get everything right.  I once had a dish that wasn't as hot as I wanted and they fell over themselves to please me -- getting it exactly right the second time.  I don't eat onions.  No problema.  I want extra sauce, or sauce on the side, or extra jalapenos.  No problema.

My latest visit, with my good friend Andrei, was typical.  I had a monstrously large Caldo de Pollo (Chicken Soup) as a dinner.  Wonderfully ample white meat chicken -- at least a breast, maybe a breast and a half.  The cilantro was fresh.  The other spices delicious.  My friends garlic chicken was similarly spectacular -- even without the red peppers he's allergic to.  All the chips, salsa, and guac that you could want.  And a price that left money for our main purpose -- playing poker.

I love variety.  And Las Vegas probably has more Mexican restaurants than any city, including Mexico D.F..  Even so, a trip to this city always includes a trip to this restaurant -- so sure am I of getting a high quality, reasonably priced, delicious meal.

Came here for some awesome menudo. First time ever! The service was amazing. Hand made tortillas. The Agua de Limon bombness in its self. Great for hangover food. Customer service on point. Went around 12pm and it starts getting packed. Come early for the afternoon type a feeling. Atmosphere was like you were in that setting of amazing culture!!

This was my first visit and I will definitely return and recommend it to friends and family. The food was delicious, the prices were great, and the service was EXCELLENT! 

I had the beef enchiladas, my wife ordered the chile rellenos, and my sons had the shrimp fajitas and steak fajitas. Plus, we had 2 margaritas and deep fried ice cream for dessert. A fantastic meal.
Third or fourth time having dinner here. Fantastic, authentic Mexican food. Richard has been our server each time. He is friendly, efficient and amusing. I highly recommend this place.

Delicious, traditional, conventional (non-fusion) Mexican food. REALLY friendly servers. Try the Gringo challenge. If I can do it, you can too (you'll see).

Really, the food was quite good, and I'm a snobby Californian saying that.

So glad we ate here and not at the over priced not real Mexican food at the strip. Super friendly staff, waiter started us out with a sopa de Fideo that was outstanding perfectly flavored broth. I couldn't make up my mind so I created my own combination plate of a carne asada sope and a chicken green enchilada. I also ordered a mangonada margarita the best margarita I have ever had.
Tasty guac, chips, margaritas and chicken mole!!  Service is always quick and friendly!  Great place to dine with friends!

Stopped in for a quick lunch and the service was amazing.Their soup is so tasty and the food is just as good. I will for sure recommend this place for a great Traditional Mexican Meal.Ill be frequenting this stop more often.

Me and my family are regulars here. The food is good and the service is awesome, especially if you have Ricardo as your waiter. If you are a seafood lover you must try the fish enpanada with their creamy sauce on top. If you are into steak their new York strip with cilantro sauce is very good. Hubby and I really enjoy the Oyster with ceviche on top (they are not stingy with the shrimp). 
We do birthday dinners here ALL the times because we love the atmosphere. 
For birthdays the waiters and waitress get together and do a band like show for the birthday person, love it!
Thank you guys for a pleasant experience we will see you soon

Yet another great experience, just when I thought it couldn't get any better...we tried the seafood combo plate..... Wow!! It was absolutely delicious. Its enough food to feed 3-4 people. We washed it all down with climato prepped beer! Another favorite of mine. Overall great food, nice atmosphere and friendly staff. I highly recommend Bonito Michoacán.

We came here with a Groupon. I was reluctant since I'm just not thrilled with the Michoacan restaurants as a whole. I find the food to be overpriced and ever so bland. But, Boyfriend wanted Mexican food, so off we went!

This location is considerably less crowded than the others. We were seated immediately and had drinks within minutes. We ordered not long after that and were eating quickly. I noticed that the menu items are cheaper than at the other locations (combination meals average $11.99, as opposed to $14). The food was marginally better than other locations, I think.

I would love to go back to this location, though, because the service was phenomenal. Seriously, the best service I've ever had, ever.

超好吃！超大份！ 点的牛扒cilantro steak，真的很棒！价格也不会贵  记得爱吃辣的你，一定要问服务员超辣酱.
但是服务生没告诉我们点得太多了......差点没撑晕

Thats is not a real mexican food we ordered chicken mole we got grilled chicken w mole on top grilled chcken con mole l am from mexico a my wife fron guatemala and she like mole but not grilled chicken horrible  and chilaquiles con huevos estrellados the eggs was raw eggs l told them to cook om they burned and the chilaquiles w no cheese and onion Would I do not eat not recommend the place is nice But the food is not real Mexican food we never come back again

Best Authentic Mexican Food!!  You gotta try the soups, chile verde and aquas chile! 
Great skinny margaritas, too!  Local people come to this restaurant. You can't go wrong!  You gotta try it. No foo foo stuff here. Just real Mexican food!!

As I was searching for another authentic Mexican food spot to try out, I decided to give this spot a try since the reviews were great. 

The service was great from entering the restaurant by being greeting by the hostess and didn't have to wait for a table. Our server was very friendly and always checked up on us and right away we were served with chips, salsa, and beans. The salsa was okay I just wish it was more fresh than watery. I ordered the guacamole since everyone recommended it and it was delicious. You get to pick what you don't want in it because they make it in front of you. I went with the steak ranchero for dinner since I felt like some steak. I have to say it was made to my liking' not too salty and not too dry. 

Can't wait to come back here and try another dish!

A pretty big disappointment all around. Decent location, ample parking. This is a plus. Enter, no clear host stand/seat yourself situation. We stood awkwardly waiting while people piled in doing the same. 

Got seated in a cute booth. Fun decor. Lighting hurts. Ceiling fans make for a strange strobe light effect. Maybe a special for Halloween? 

Service is terrible - possibly the worst in Vegas. Our "server" was Israel (so says our receipt). Forever to greet us. We probably were 1/3 way done with complimentary chips (the salsa is hot, the bean dip with is excellent) before he remembered to ask someone to bring water to our table. We ordered cocktails. They came out separately. By about ten minutes. 

Ordered an appetizer (ceviche - pretty okay). Israel came by to ask for our entree order. We said we wanted to wait for our appetizer before we ordered our entrees. It had been a while. He gives us an "oh yeah!" Guess he forgot that too. 

Ordered our meals. A table sat down after us. They got the included soup and chip refills AND entrees before us. We had to ask for included soup - from I'm assuming a food runner - he was hustling though! 

Our busboy had our meals boxed for us before Israel came by to see how they were. 

Food was okay (pollo al cognac). Not worth going back for, when such terrible, neglectful service is "provided". Definitely not worth the price though. 

However, shout out to Domingo, our hardworking busboy who kept our water full and table clean. The server could learn a thing or seven from his work ethic and care for guests. 

Sucks it's so close to home, but I'd say it's worth the drive for ANY (maybe even Bell of Taco) other mexican food in the area.

Cute decor and authentic setting. It seems like they are trying to be an upscale Mexican restaurant but the staff and setting don't agree. We ordered table side guacamole but never got it. Asked to have it removed from the bill and waiter made it out like he was doing us a huge favor to remove it. Food was pretty good, we had steak fajitas and tamales.

This place reminds me of a El Torito chain with mildly better food.  I started at the bar while we waited for our table. I ordered a negro modelo and she handed me a bottle.   I had to ask for a glass and I got my own lime wedge.  The appitizer selection was a bit week so I started with just a dinner salad.   I thought they might have some  mexican infused dressing but nope. Bottle sauces.   For my entre I had the cilantro steak.  The steak had a lot of silver skin and the steak was covered in sauce but lacked much flavor.   This is a typical gringofied mexican restaurant.   You guerro friends will thank you.
Best Mexican food! Authentic, and great customer service. I've made it a tradition to stop by before leaving Vegas!

Everything you expect from a great Mexican restaurant.

Very home-ish feel. Good food. Good service.

Parking lot in front of the restaurant. No wait on Saturday night for dinner.

Everyone in my party had something different and it was all delicious.  

Will definitely be back.

Not sold on Bonito Michoacan.  Food was mediocre.  Guacamole was wonderful- avocados freshly cut in front of us.  Sangria tasted like cheap box wine with lemons.  Shrimp enchiladas were good.  Would stray away from this place but wouldn't suggest it. Maybe better for takeout...
We pulled thus up on Yelp and with the reviews. We decided to try it. Everything was amazing from the service to the food.

Just tried this place tonight. I liked the free margarita that they give you just for checking in on yelp. I ordered chicken enchiladas with green sauce and they were really good. They came with rice and beans. I thought that the service was good, but I didn't get asked if I wanted anything else to drink when my margarita was getting low, but that is okay. My friend ordered the steak in coca-cola sauce which was good. I think if I end up going back here, I may order this dish. I liked the laid-back atmosphere of the restaurant and the prices were good as well.

Pretty standard mexican fare. Cheesy mexican lounge singer singing christmas music added to the ambiance or something. I had the camarones al cognac which was in a rich cream sauce and quite good. My mom had some camarones a la diabla or something like that was spicy, but it masqueraded any flavor. The rice and beans were not good. The salsa was pretty good, had a good kick to it. It was okay, but definitely not the best I've had. Their menu is massive, which yields a lot of choices for groups. Standard is all I can say. And the booths are definitely not at a normal height.

Excellent service, excellent service, excellent food.  The prices are a little high, but they don't nickel and dime you for more chips and salsa.  They also have fresh refried beans with those homemade chips..  Staff was very attentive and in point, this is the kind of place that will bag your to-go portions for you.. awesome. Overall this place was very nice and I highly recommend stopping by.
The restaurant is a classic family owned mexican cantina vibe with quality food and a fun atmosphere. The menu is large and the drinks are strong. Definite a solid place to check out.

I can't write a review because I'm too busy enjoying my chamoy margarita and delicious food!! Seriously, A+ guys. I haven't found a decent Mexican food place since I moved out to Vegas 4 years ago, and this place is like a dream come to life. GREAT service, excellent margaritas, and as authentic as you can get!  I'm in love!!

Its really Mexican food in a great ambiance. The service is A1. I had the freshest soup since I live in Vegas. The ingredients were naturals. As many places they alway serve chips with salsa. I would go again.

Better service, better food, and a LOT less crowded (although it's only Tuesday..), than their counterpart Lindo Michoacan there in Henderson.

Sure, sure, Lindo has the spectacular views and what not, and their food is decent but all of that gets cancelled out when you're in a packed and noisy (super kid friendly) restaurant. Moving right along..

Back to Bonito!

Greeted by a friendly gentleman and escorted to our table, my eyes scanned the room to observe the typical, I mean traditional Mexican themed decor; vibrant colors, cheesy artwork, and no Mexican restaurant would be complete without "football" on the telly. My party and I giggled at the music selection throughout our entire meal, it went from Latin Country, to Latin Classic Rock, and my all time favorite, Latin elevator music. I have saved the best for last though folks when it comes to the decor at good ol' Bonito Michoacan..THE MILLIONS OF CLOWNS EVERYWHERE!

What's up with clowns amigos? I just don't get how creepy clowns and puppets dangling from the ceiling tie in to delicious home made guacamole and sizzling, cooked to perfection fajitas. The clowns didn't sit well with me, but luckily their food did! (*round of applause from my stomach*) 

In any event, this fine dining establishment earns 4-starts on the Kim-scale-o-food-places, the fifth lacking for, well, it's no real mystery here: the clown decor (ok and I don't fancy the location either).

Great job Bonito, I'm not positive you would be the first place I would pick should the mood for Mexican food strike again, but you're for sure in my top 5!

If you are going to dinner with another person order the Tierra Cliente. This dish comes steaming hot with chicken breast, carne asada, carnitas and chorizo stuffed jalapeños. 
With a compliment of beans and rice you will need a to go bag and several hours of exercise to work it off. 
Great service and hot food. Absolutely worth it

I typically hate going to mexican restaurants because I usually leave thinking that I could have made better mexican food at home but this place totally made me feel like I was at home eating my own homemade food. Their guacamole is delicious, the beans were so good, tacos were fried perfectly and not greasy. My husband had the chile rellenos and enchilada and loved them. My son had the fideo and quesadillas, he said his dinner was "the best" :D Our favorite was the sopa de fideo. This is the first restaurant I have been to that offered it in their menu and it tasted totally homemade and was incredibly delicious!! Also the service was awesome, probably the best we've had in a long time. Waiters were friendly, our drinks and chips/dip were never empty, and they made sure to check in with us pretty often. Highly recommend this place! Will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas!!!

Another great meal (and I ate too much!). Service was great, nice atmosphere and live music that is not obnoxious.
This is an main stay for Mexican food with plenty of options to choose from.
Great margaritas!

Received free margarita for checking in, so decided to go here for Cinco De Mayo. The margarita was served on the rocks in a very small glass. We could not taste any liquor in the drink,  and noticed other folks paying for their drinks had full size glasses. We've been traveling the southwest (new mexico, arizona, california and west tx) for a month eating at a different Mexican restaurant every day and this place is nothing out of the ordinary. The flour tortillas tasted store bought and the green chili verde was gross, pork rubbery not falling apart like we are used to. The chips, salsa and bean dip are served complimentary, but did not wow us. Our server Lorenzo was arrogant and acted as if we inconvenienced him. Worst food we have had in a month. We will not be back. Go to Yuma or Tucson for some really great authentic Mexican cuisine.

Walked in and was greeted by friendly faces, assigned a table, drinks brought. I waited for the waiter ... And waited ... Had to get someone to get him. Party of 5 by the way. Finally he shows up, waited for my food ... And waited .... I liked the food wife did not like her's. Finished my
Food. Check was brought promptly.  Waited for him to come get the card to ring me up ... And waited ... And waited ... Wife left with two of my three kids .... I still waited ... And waited ... And waited. One of my kids fell asleep cause im still waiting  and waiting .... Still wai.. Zzzzzzz ... Zzzzzz

Came here for Mother's day 2014. Sign said open at 9am, but the doors were still locked.  As we were walking a lady said the door will open shortly.  9:15 the door finally open, guess who opened the door...yup the lady that was walking from her car.  Can you say getting to work late?!

Anyways we order chilaquiles, one with red sauce and the other with green sauce with eggs.   It was okay.

Two kids plate,  one had a long hair in the rice. Yuk as my daughter commented.  They comp one of the kids meal and gave her a plate of new rice.

Julio did an excellent job, but the women Griselda (i think that is how you spell her name) was rude. She didn't acknowledge when we ask for things and her body language came across very negative.  What a disappointment since it was our first and probably will be our last time here. 

Thanks for an unforgettable start to mother's day. 
Glad we still have the entire day to make more memories.

This place never disappoints! Food is always fresh, customer service is always the same. Same friendly faces all the time. I come to Vegas for business every month and always look forward to breakfast and dinner here. Definitely a customer for life!

I'm back at it again with the yummie Bonito.. I really like this place with the happy hour and the drinks are great. I love coming here it reminds me of the real deal LA food. I've been to other Mexican restaurants but this one just makes me want to come back for more. 

The service is great. When we go there we try to go during happy hour. I always have to order the Ceviche, Street tacos (carne asada, carnitas and pastor), sopitos and Toreados con chorizo. The hubs just shares with me but like to order the guacamole and chips. But the drinks oh man I get the Paloma and margarita.  The hubs get the beer. The tacos are delish, reminds me of LA taco trucks. Love the home made sopitos.  It is made in house which is amazing. The Treados con chorizo is good but I think I would rather just have cheese but then that would be called Chili Relleno. Good stuff this place has. With great happy hour price can't beat that for Mexican food.
A nice mexican restaurant!!! Very good food!!! Our server donal was very kind and funny, litle bit loud cause of the tv , but is ok
Este restaurant no tiene el servicio excelente como dice la gente como es posible que una soda de maquina la vendan en $ 2.50 cuando es casi solo agua y ni si quiera  rellenan

I'm surprised by all of the 4 and 5 star reviews for this place. I found the food to be very blah.
Let me first say that the service was excellent. The servers were so friendly and checked on us often. If it weren't for them I would have given 2 stars.

The meal started off with chips, salsa and bean dip. The bean dip was ok but the beans really had no flavor and were very runny. The salsa was horrible.  It was also watery thin and had a weird flavor. After what I heard about this place I was excited to try the salsa but I prefer a chunky fresh salsa and this tastes like something from a can.

Then came a cup of Fideo Soup for us. This was tasty and it had a lot of noodle in it. 

For my meal I had the #4 which consisted of a cheese enchilada, beef taco and a bean tostada with guacamole. Blah blah blah! The enchilada had barely any cheese in it and the sauce they put on top was as nasty and weird tasting as the salsa. The beef taco was cute and small but the beef had no flavor. My tostada had beans and tons of lettuce.. The small of guacamole I had was actually very tasty. I would never order this again I just didn't care for it and the taste. I could have done with out all the lettuce and had more of the other stuff on it.

My man had Fajitas and he said they weren't as good as Ricardo's or Cabo but he said they were decent. I tried a piece of his flour tortilla and I have to say I should have just ordered a stack of those and some guacamole because the tortillas were good. And the tortillas weren't small either they were a decent size.

The pic I took and posted on here looks way more appetizing then it really was. I tried to like it but I just honestly didn't :(

They had a man singing live music which was a nice touch. and happy hour specials  but during happy hour a margarita is still going to run you $4.50.

I don't see when we would be back here since there are other yummy Mexican places around town and especially with Ricardo's just down the street.

Good food and great portions. They keep the fresh tortilla chips with beans and salsa coming. I got the pollo con rajas y crema, which was freaking awesome. Oh, and you get a free margarita if you check in.

Great Mexican authentic food. Read about this place and decided to try it next time I was in Vegas; It's like El Toritos Mexican food but better.  The hot bean dip they bring to the table is good.  I ordered the chese enchilada and beef taco hard shell you don't see hard shells these days anymore.  Service and ambience were good. I would return next time in Vegas.
Awesome!  Had their steak cognac and it was killer.  Great service too.

Well, I think I know why their other location closed down...

We had very bad customer service this time around. We have been to the other location that got closed down (Viva Michoacan in Henderson). It took forever for them to take our order, the waiter forgot about my guacamole & sour cream, they forgot to refill my boyfriend's soda and my friend pronounced the very long Spanish word that supposedly earned him a free margarita...which they never brought.

Yes, I'm Mexican so let me say that the food is mediocre. I think you'd had better luck going to Pepe's Tacos down the street. The beans needed salt and. I felt that they were like Rosarito beans that you get from a can and just heat up. I don't understand why all their burritos are smothered in sauce and cheese. that's more of a enchilada...and if I wanted an enchilada I'd order one. A burrito is meant to be eaten with hands, not with a fork.

Amazing Food and Experience! Took 4 others with me to celebrate my birthday. We made reservations earlier in the day for 6:30pm. We walked in and were sat immediately. They had a Yelp checkin that offered us a free margarita so we all checked in and got some. Our Servers were Awesome and they care very much about making our experience with them Wonderful. They sang to me with a band of fellow servers and gave me dessert and tequila slammer to top it off.

Needless to say we Highly recommend Bonita Michoacan!

Must try the carnitas and Enchiladas with green sauce.

Very good food and great portion:price ratio. -1 star for slight inconsistencies at every visit. Sometimes the beans are more runny, and sometimes the salsa is more watery than other times. Sometimes the Chile relllenos are completely stuffed with cheese, and sometimes there's much less. When. It's very busy and they have large parties, the smaller tables can be forgotten about regarding refills. Minor things like this can be easily overlooked because the taste and quality is always great and staff is always friendly.

Today we decided to have Mexican food for lunch.  We have been here before, but I have never reviewed this restaurant.

We started out with the chips and salsa along with bean dip.  I could actually make a meal out of these alone, but I paced myself.  Unlike my last review I was able to get my favorite Raspberry Iced Tea, and it was delicious.

Mom had a Chicken Chimichanga, our daughter had a Steak Burrito, and I ordered a Chopped Beef Burrito.  All of them came with the usual rice and beans.  We ordered a side of Guacamole and to our surprise, our server Lorenzo brought out all of the ingredients including the fresh avocados and began to prepare it right there at our table.  He seasoned it just to our liking and wow, delicious.

Mom and I spooned the fresh guacamole on our burritos, mmm, a nice added spice to an already delicious burrito.

Lorenzo was a great server, very attentive to our needs, and of course, our drinks never went dry.

Overall, Bonito Michoacan is an excellent restaurant and we will certainly be back.

We are from LA where thiers an abundance of Mexican restaurants,, but when we leave it's seams hard to find a decent restaurant that's authentica Mexicana. This hidden gem of the strip tailors to the local clientele.  What a treat it is. They would of gotten a 5 star from me but. Customer service is a bit busy. This restaurant can probably hold 200 plus. And frequently they do. So food is great! But service is slow. Try the homemade gugamole, just like mom made at home right in front of you ( table side.) Thanks Vegas coming back soon again.

Good authentic Mexican food. Huge servings and good flavor. My only issue was the service. Our server was not very friendly and honestly seemed impatient with us when we placed our order. The hostess was nice when we walked in but just the server was not nice. 

I enjoyed my Posole and enchilada. Oh and the free chips and salsa were very good too. They also give you free bean dip. 

We did get a free picture with our meal. The girl was trying to sell us photos but when we opted out she gave us our free picture and also seemed annoyed. Oh well. 

For the food in itself I would probably go back but wish the service was better.
