Great food. Good drinks. Closest to my mother in laws home cooked meal that I have found. Love the live music on the weekend. Great place for large groups.my favorite is the menudo on the weekends. The shrimp cocktail is yummy to.

I really like this place. We come here pretty often and never really have a bad meal. Service is hit or miss, but we usually have a good time. My favorite dishes are the green pork burrito, whole fried fish and menudo. The salsa is good and spicy too.

We've been coming here for a couple years now since we found it. The environment is colorful and culturally authentic to the food. Although I haven't quite yet figured out how the dolls & clowns play into it but whatever, it's fun to look at. 
The staff has always been very friendly and on point with their customer service. My glass is never empty, the buss boys are like ninja re-fillers. 
I love that they do table side guacamole and you can make it as mild or spicy as you like. Chips, salsa and bean dip come to the table when you first sit down. 
One of my favorite dishes here is their fajitas. Shrimp and/ or chicken. The tortillas are home made, you can't beat that! Fideo soup usually comes with an entree. I always add a little salsa for a kick. 
If you're celebrating a birthday be sure to let them know. They'll come on over and sing in English & Spanish. 
We always save room for some sopapillas too.

Bonito Michoacan - 
Consistent excellent service, food, and affordable selections. (I'm getting hungry just thinking about your menu)
So this is what we are experiencing. We like to take our visiting guest out to a nice dinner (affordable). Throughout the years that we have been taking our guest to your restaurant, you have never let us down. 
So now, we have created clientele for you driving in from the Bay Area, California wanting to dine at your restaurant. 
We will see you soon as our California family member wishes to celebrate her 17th birthday at your restaurant. 
Thank you for all the great food, awesome service, and the smiles you bring to my family.
I love love LOVE this place!!!! Great authentic Mexican restaurant.  Every time I'm in Vegas I make sure to stop here for some yummy food.

Our favorite Mexican restaurant of all time. We've been going here for 10 years and never had a bad experience. Table side guacamole is delicious and neat presentation made in front of you.  I've tried about everything and loved it. Lorenzo or Julio take great care of you.
Real authentic Mexican food. If your looking for something off the strip and want a family style restaurant, this is the place to be!

I was having a bad day and was in a horrible mood. Came here to eat and relax with my girlfriend. Juan totally turned my day around, he was the best server I've had in a long time. He Turned my night around and I left in a better mood. Food was good, price was affordable. I will be back again!

Free Margarita with check in.  I got the steak with cheese enchilada, rice, and beans.  It also came with your choice of tortillas.  The complementary soup of fideo was to delicious!!! I would come back here again.  There are TVs throughout the place for game action too.

Granted there were two large parties in our area, but service was extremely slow and inattentive. The food was ok, nothing extraordinary, but not bad. We waited 19 minutes after we were visibly done with our meal for our waiter to finally come back by and ask if we were ready, then it took probably another 10 minutes to get our check give him the card and get it back. I went in at 8pm thinking it could be a nice quick dinner and took almost 2 hours for 2 people..just seems ridiculous to me.

Superb Mexican food.  Although we had to take a cab there and we wanted to stop at the market before returning to our condo, the drove us to the market.  They did say that the sometime pickup and return customers to the strip, but not sure of details.

This restaurant has a very welcoming and casual atmosphere and the hostesses and waiters are very friendly. For starters, complimentary fresh fried tortilla chips are served with warm bean dip and red salsa or you can request for the spicier habanero salsa which I love. They also give you a complimentary small bowl of fideo soup to wet your appetite. For appetizers, we ordered the beef sopitos which were very juicy and delicious topped with guacamole and sour cream. If you checkin with your Yelp account, they give you a free margarita! I always end up getting full just from the the complimentary appetizers, so save room for the delicious entrees. 

For dinner we ordered the Carnitas Michoacanas and the Chicken Mole Poblano. The carnitas were cooked in spices and were very succulent and tasty. They are served with a green salsa and a spicy charred jalapeño, yum! The chicken mole poblano was juicy and served smothered in a flavorful, mildly spicy and sweet brown mole sauce, so good! Both entrees are served with Mexican rice and warm beans topped with cheese. 
Also all of the entrees come with freshly made corn or flour tortillas that are warm and delicious. We always leave here stuffed, satisfied and with leftovers because the portions are huge!

Every time I'm in town I try to swing by.
I love the locals vibe. 
The bar is fantastic!!!!

This place caught my eye Becuase of its colorful exterior building design outside. I mentioned this place up to my girlfriend ,and so she decided to take me here on a Sunday lunch. We had this excellent waiter which I totally forgot his name. But he was very friendly and explained everything on the menu. We checked in on Yelp to receive our free margaritas which was awesome. He only downfall about this place was just the ceviche tasted a little watered down but my main dish made up for this restaurant. The steak was really juicy with my side of salsa to balance the flavor. Complimentary chips and salsa of course is the best.

The best in Vegas by far. This is where the locals go for Mexican. Many different dishes not just tacos, burritos etc. Many seafood dishes.  Service was exceptional. They make the to taste right at the table.  Drinks are also good. As an added attraction there is a lady making tortillas right in the front. Not the easiest place to find but worth the search.
Had lunch here yesterday before heading back to LA. Ordered camarones a la diabla. Service was great.

My 2 friends, son (toddler) and I ate here about 2 weeks ago and we loved nearly every minute of our lunch! We had the cerviche and shrimp cocktail for appetizers and they were both awesome.  I wanted street tacos but I guess that's only during happy hour but the tacos I had were decent. I really enjoyed a much needed Michelada as well! Our sever was really great, I'm kicking myself since I can't recall his name (blame the memory issue on the 1 Michelada) but it was like he knew what I needed just before I asked for it. We will be back and I'm very happy to see that the quality of food or device hasn't gone down over the years! Gracias!!

Came here again and as per usual, the food is great and so was service. Unfortunately our eyes are bigger than our stomachs so we didnt manage to finish our meals. If we had a fridge and microwave in our hotel we would have taken home the leftovers.
The tableside guac is a nice touch and made to your tastes.
This is a must stop every visit to Las Vegas, the bacon wrapped is the bomb. Great food all around and great Margaritas.
Slow service.....food was good, but waited 30 min to get check AFTER credit card slip was signed. Then found waitress having a lunch break when I went to ask what was taking so long.

I recently moved from Cali and was looking for some bomb Mexican food. I definitely found it here. The whole family was pleased. They give you chips, salsa and beans as soon as you sit down. Than they bring you tomato Fidel soup. Oh my so yummy. The customer service here is off the chart. all the way around.
Chile relleno was excellent.. Free margarita with check in.. You know a Mexican restaurant is excellent when over half the customers are Latino...
Place is fire.. The atmosphere is a bit loud but food is amazing. Ceviche extremely fresh and the steak is on point

I'm not going to claim "I know REAL Mexican" - who's to decide what is?What I will say is this is my favorite Mexican restaurant. They have one of the best Moles I've had.  Recommend the Pollo sarandeado Tia Esther and the buckwheat noodle soup.

My husband and I found this restaurant through Yelp's reviews as we were looking for Mexican food off of the Strip. This was, by far, the best Latino food that we have ever had. The atmosphere was great and everyone working there greeted us warmly and were very friendly throughout. There was a Mariachi band playing, but not too loud, and everything just felt comfortable. The decor was bright and festive, but it was not over the top. The thing that we noticed first was that almost everyone eating there was Latino, and that, to us, is always a good sign of authentic food. The food did not disappoint. Everything was so good overall that we came back the next day for lunch before heading back home-- just to get another taste of it. The best of what we tried: the oysters (I am not a fan but my husband ate the heck out of them happily), the cheese fundo, and the guacamole. The warm, homemade tortillas were the best tortillas I have ever had as well, and if I could somehow magically have them at my house every day, I would be eating a steady diet of them. All in all, a good value for the money, a nice experience, and wonderful food.

Great atmosphere, but that's where it ends.  The dips were okay, not the best salsa.  The rest of the food was terrible.  The red sauce was like someone opened a can of tomato sauce and poured it on top.  not the worse Mexican food we've had, but close.
Love the Mexican food here, went this weekend with my in-laws and they loved it too. Some friends of ours introduced us to this place and were hooked. Mexican pizza is delicious.

I always get the same thing at Mexican restaurants, shredded beef taco and chicken enchilada with rice and beans. I've eaten here about 3 times and I think I keep going back because of their lunch specials. Their rice and beans is not the best. Sometimes when the main dish sucks, I can just fill up on rice and beans and be ok with that. But not here. They do have good horchata and my boyfriend absolutely loves this place. I don't know, just me I guess.

We celebrated my wife's birthday here and the waiter got the mariachis to come sing Happy Birthday in Spanish and English and put a big sombrero on her head while she downed a shot of tequila mixed in lime juice. I recommend the 16-ounce rib eye with a bone. We only went here because the one on DI was closed for the employees Christmas party.

Love the Margachela (margarita) and their service! Look for Julio (attendant) and Jose (food server) you will love your time there and the cozy atmosphere and the very cultural ambience and wood carved, painted chairs and tables. Lovely tine and friendly people!

I love this place! Great service, food and usually there's fun music. Ask for the extra spicy salsa (not just the habanero one) because it's delish! 

It's a go-to for date night when we don't want to spend a bumch of money.
My favorite Mexican restaurant in all of vegas. Great customer service, awesome energy, easy parking, and hands down the tastiest Mexican food every time I go!

Proud to make this my first ever Yelp review. This place is one of the few restaurants I've ever been to that give you a full on "experience" from beginning to end. A group of friends and I in our travels dropped in due to a free margarita promotion and the party started with our awesome waiter, Richard. Then I - a black guy - took on the Gringo challenge (not spoiling it, go and take it on yourself) and got another free drink! The food was top notch and pardon the misogyny but the ladies are gorgeous too, please respect them as they want to make sure your time there is optimal with pictures and drinks as well. I'd type more but the tequila is working  go here!!!

What can I say.. Excellent customer service.  The food was  delicious.  It was so worth the money.  Authentic Mexican food.  I haven't had any Mexican  food that tastes like this in years! I highly recommend visiting this place

1) long wait to order
2) long wait for food after ordering
3) 3 out of 4 meals were cold
4) salsa and bean dip were pretty good. 

We ate-
Carnitas- (pile of meat. Not much else)
Sopes- looked ok. But was cold
Chile Rellano de camarone- cold chile rellanos aren't very good
Chicken burrito- cold. Not much flavor. 

Yes, we could have sent cold food back. But after the wait, we were pretty much ready to eat and leave.
This place had really friendly service. The food came out fast and hot. The food was great especially the fresh guacomole that they make infront of you, just the way you would like it.

The husband and I came here on a whim because I had an overwhelming craving for Mexican food. We searched via yelp and luckily were just down the street. 
Juan might be the best server we have ever encountered- he was fun and personable. The food was authentic Mexican, genuine Michoacan flavor! We had the carnitas plate and eggs with shredded pork, highly recommend both dishes and this restaurant. We've decided to make this a tradition and stop here every time we come to Vegas!
Seriously good food, and great service!  Very authentic,  and they made stuff for our group that wasn't even on the menu!

By far one of my favorite Mexican restaurants that I've found here in Vegas. Traditional Mexican food. First time here and thus far I'm loving it. Great atmosphere, great service and beast of all great quality food! I'll definitely be frequenting this place more often. Thanks Saul for your service! My only complain... homemade tortillas yes..... but though to eat.

OMG I'm in LOVE with this place. I grew up and lived in this area and have been going to Bonito Michoacan for years. It's the best mexican restaurant that I know of in Las Vegas. I always start off with thethe part. Their steak pacado is my #1 dish!! 

I love this place so much that everytime my husband asks me where we want to go on my birthday I choose Bonito! MMM! 5 stars all the way!

We've been going to Bonito's for a few years and I'm not sure why I haven't added a review yet.. Anyways the food is great, the staff is friendly and it's a fun place to go.  Juan the waiter is a superstar and I think he has quite a following.  Always hugs both my husband and I when we arrive and leave.
The guacamole made at your table is so good, and last night I tried their ceviche for the first time and that too was yummy!  Of course the margaritas aren't bad either!  Love this place!

Parking here is super easy! If you go left when you walk in you'll see a full bar and they do karaoke! If you want it a LITTLE more quiet sit on the right side. My hubby and my daughter went with another couple who also had a 3yo and they had an easily accessible table for the 6 of us. Us ladies ordered frozen guava margaritas which were veeeeery tasty and the consistency was very smooth. I'm usually a rocks kinda girl and I'm truly not a guava fan but I tried hers and needed one too!!! While we were deciding our server brought out sopa de fideo for the kids which was nice because we didn't even ask!
Now to the food! With the location of this place the prices surprised the hell out of me.....I'm not saying it was über expensive but the average was probably $15 which is a little out there for a Mexican restaurant IMO. Every meal comes with chips, salsa, and beans and the sopa. I had birria de chiva which is goat cooked in a red sauce or was pretty delish! Hubby had a shrimp/octopus coctel it was the usual nothin special. The other couple had an enchilada and then shrimp fajitas. All pretty ordinary. I did see they make guacamole table side and got to watch another table have it made it looked pretty cool!  We were too full for dessert... 
Service was good
Drinks were awesome 
The food...nothin special.
Will I return, yes! I think I'm gonna try somethin different/unique so they can change my mind a lil :)

*The BEST Fideo soup. Ever. 

My favorite Mexican Food place in town, hands down. Better than Viva Zapta's, Roberto's and some of the more expensive places. They give you free chips, salsa and bean dip from the get go. If you order an entree they bring the tomato/noodle (fideo) soup out pre-meal as well. The enchiladas are fluffy and cheesey and the enchilada sauce isn't so strong or greasy it gives you heartburn. The 'Mexican Pizza' appetizer is awesome, very crunchy with light fluffy chicken (or beef if you choose) on top. They'll make guacamole right at your table for like $7. It can get a little chunky if you put everything in it, but it's a big amount you can take home. I enjoy everything I order here and have heard rave reviews about the Steak Ranchero as well. Haven't had anything bad yet. I'd like to save room for once to try their fried icecream, it looks like they give a generous portion!

If you're looking for more authentic taste like home Mexican food, this is your place! When you seated they bring out bottomless chips with salsa and bean dip, they also bring out Fideo all complimentary. The food proportions are huge and the food is amazing. You definitely won't leave this place hungry. Not to mention the excellent staff & customer service. Been coming here for years.

Went here a couple of weeks ago on a weekend at about 3:30-4'ish.  There were a few people in there but it wasn't packed.  I had the Sopes,  (Sopes -Three  handmade tortillas gorditas, lightly deep fried. Topped with chorizo, carne asada or pollo asado.) with carne asada a taco, basically, but with a  thicker, fried corn tortilla, complete with onions, cilantro, etc.  No sissy lettuce and tomato on these tacos.  It also came with beans and rice (some of the better rice I've had, I find it always to be dry and bland, but I like flavor) I finished 2 of them (out of the 3 I had), but couldn't handle eating anymore.  My boyfriend had a dish that was even better than mine.  I can't remember the name of it, but I'm waiting for him to answer me so I know what it is. - Now I know! It was the Steak Picado- (New York steak in small chunks, sautéed with onions, cilantro, jalapeños, tomatoes and mixed with Spanish & verde sauce.) I remember, it was nice chunks of meat in a red sauce (not mole, not chile colorado), I took a bite of it, and the meat was incredibly tender, not the dry, in the crockpot for 6 hours, shredded tender, the tender that only comes from a good piece of meat.  It yields slightly, but as soon as you bit in, it's pure, soft, moist bliss.  And no gristle!  Their handmade tortillas are also very, very good.  I watched the nice lady make tortillas the whole time I was there, she was a busy lady!  
We finished it off with the fried ice cream.  To me, it left more to be desired.  The coating seemed...almost stale, it was hard to chew and the ice cream was just plain vanilla ice cream.  I heard the table next to us order the fried banana after the waiter's suggestion, they seemed satisfied with it and finished the whole thing.  All in all, I will definitely go here again, just on the Steak Picado alone.

Had a nice lunch with my sisters on a Sunday afternoon around 12pm. Busy, busy, busy!

The food is always very delicious which receives a 5 Star, but I rated this review a 4 Star because the servers were not very attentive and seemed like they really didnt care. Upon checking in on yelp, you can receive one free house margarita, which we showed to the waiter. He wanted to take our phones to the bartender...Whoa...ah, no you cannot take our phones to the bar(which was on the other side of the restaurant! Would you let a person who you did not know, take your phone and your sisters to the bar? No! LOL. So, I had to walk all the way to the bar and show the bartender myself. I thought that was weird and not very professional. Anyways, after that incident, it seemed like the waiter became dis-interested. Our water glasses were never refilled, had to continually ask for a refill of the salsa and chips, and when we were presented our check, he just set it down and never said thank you.
Ok, I know they were very busy, but it just seemed like he could careless. We would have left a higher tip, but felt like we really weren't treated very well(we have been dining here for years).

All in all, the food is great and I will continue to dine here.
Get a free margarita when you check-in on Yelp! Generous portions of delicious Mexican dishes :)
Parese un restaurat de fast food la parrillada fria nada q ver con el otro de la desertinn por el mismo precio la atencion desordenada
Amazing Mexican food and service !! Authentic Mexican food and very friendly environment ! Will definitely be back when I'm in Vegas again

Why I keep coming this place? Well, Because I really like the authentic Mexican food and here you have it. My wife is from Michoacán and she said that the food is definitely authentic from Michoacán.  This time I ordered mole with chicken, oh wow. It was delicious. The pasta soup they serve is so tasteful. The margaritas are so delicious. The personal is so friendly. They speak English or Spanish. Your preference.
Excellent food and service. Reasonably priced. Not touristy - local favorite and off the strip. One of my favorites in Vegas.
Great service. Good food. And a free margarita to boot if you check in through yelp.  Would go back in a heartbeat!!

Delicious. 1st timers and was not disappointed. The wifey ordered the cheese enchiladas but wanted white sauce, not red. Our server Richard, suggested another sauce cooked with cognac. Needless to say, wifey killed the plate. I ordered the chicken fajitas. Can't go wrong and didn't. The grilled tortillas were a nice touch. Will be back for sure. 

PS, don't forget to check in on Yelp and get your free margarita.

Excellent menu of traditional Mexican cuisine.  We had a group of 12, everybody ordered something different.  Everything was great.  The staff was friendly, the service prompt.  I had the carnitas, they were moist and flavorful.  This place is off the strip but not too far.  I would highly recommend it.  We come here every time we visit Vegas.
Came to Vegas and was a bit tired of the overpriced Vegas Strip food. I love coming to this place when I visit from LA. I highly recommend it!

There is no better mexican food in las vegas as far as I am concerned. The service is top notch the food is excellent and fast! Do yourself a favor and order the table side guacamole! You will not be disappointed !!
Great place to eat! Excellent authentic Mexican food  sope, enchiladas, taquitos, burritos & carnitas michoacan

Delicious Mexican food with an authentic feeling environment.  If you are looking for some tasty Mexican food, it's tough to find a better place that Bonito Michoucan.  It's definitely one of the top places in town.

If you were a fan of Viva Michoacan on Sunset, you're probably still crying about its close.  Well, dry those tears!  This place has recipes that are similar, if not the same, as Viva!  The soup, tortillas, and dishes like Shrimp Dionisia and Chicken Zirahuen are to die for.  And the service!  Our waiter was so nice - you truly feel welcome there.  And if that wasn't enough, there was a man playing music, too!  Excellent Mexican food, excellent service, and prices way better than the Lindo in GVR.  We will drive out of our way to Bonita whenever we want the best.  PS- Football fans - there are TVs everywhere!

Great food. Not great atmosphere. But when you are with good company, that part matters less. 

Pros: 
chips, salsa, bean dip, yum 
tasty tomato base soup for free, yum 
good margaritas and they made my specialty margarita correctly! 
friendly and attentive staff 

Cons: 
odd decor - clowns....creepy 
odd floor plan 
right when you walk in you can see the nasty kitchen lights because the wall around the kitchen is low 

I had a poblano cream chicken dish with rice and beans. OMG. TDF! I couldn't stop eating. 

We will be back! I just recommend a little redesign/redecorating. Hire someone to help with that. Don't just let the wife/daughter of the owner handle it. A professional who can help make it more appealing and attractive and updated.
We stopped by on Super Bowl weekend and were not disappointed the food was great Bam Bam was at his best. One of the most interesting men in the world ! Friendly and entertaining waiter.

authentic mexican. live music, bar, attire & decor
make fresh salsa & guacamole tableside. my tea never got 1/2 empty. more chips & salsa without ever asking
truly the best authentic mexican yet!! very spicy & meats were tender and juicy. crispy tacos too
a truly authentic mexican joint with great lunch specials. $5.99/$7.99/$9.99 for 1/2/3 item combos

Looks are deceiving let me tell you! 

This is NOT REAL MEXICAN FOOD. The salsa had no flavor the chips were stale 
The coffee creamer was expired! Oh man our plates blaahhh!! We got huevos rancheros and chilaqueles it was horrible rice was nasty dry the salsa on top of the food was straight out of a can! Yuck! Never again.. 

I'M MEXICAN THIS FOOD IS NASTY STAY AWAY!! I KNOW WHAT I'M TELLING YOU!!

I really like the food here. the restaurant itself is really cute from the outside looks like something that belongs in Mexico! I love it

they sang me happy birthday with a full mariachi it sounded like. the staff is really nice and attentive. 

good place to come if your in Vegas and in the mood for some Mexican food.

I took my parents here when they came for a visit. We celebrated my birthday with fajitas and margaritas! I had the chicken fajitas and they were cooked to perfection! The noodle soup that comes before the meal is one of my favorite appetizers! My mother and I had traditional margaritas and we both agreed they were definitely made with love and great skill. All margaritas are not created equal, some leave you feeling weighed down with all the sweetness, not these! They were made perfectly! The service was great and my birthday tequila shot was awesome (not much of a shot person, but it was sweetened with some lemon juice and it went down smooth). The cinnamon churros with whipped cream were a nice end to a wonderful birthday dinner!

Best food in town! Make sure to request Richard as your server, he's the best!! 
And special bday dance for the ladies 
Don't forget to order table side guacamole and queso fondido

I have passed by this location many times and they always have a nice crowd. Tonight, we decided to try out Bonito for my birthday dinner. The atmosphere was authentic and our server was very helpful.  I had the chorizo tacos, which were filled with their homemade chorizo and served with rice, beans, and a scoop of guacamole. Their chorizo was good, not too spicy, but smoky. My partner got a combination platter with a chile relleno, taco, and enchilada. He said everything was good as well.

This location offered a free house margarita for checking in for Yelp users. The drink was actually very good and I ordered another. I did notice they only give each table one complimentary chips/salsa/beans starter and charging $3.50 for additional refills. I have to say I've never encountered this, even at more upscale restaurants.  The beans served were good, the salsa a little too smoky for me.

All in all, Bonito offered an authentic Mexican dinner for my birthday this year. There was a nice live band performing and the service was very good. We will more than likely be back to try some other options.

Okay HI! We tried a different place each night on this last little jaunt to Vegas and because I am so much of a Smartina Navratolova I wanted Mexican food and so I went to my Yelp app on my Smart phone and searched for a highly rated restaurant with reasonable prices and Bonito Michoacan came right up.  We were in the neighborhood (my brother in law is Chinese) so we hung a U and drove right into the parking lot (yeah buddy they even have parking fa YA)! 

We went inside and the place is beautiful.  There is a beautiful woman who hand makes tortillas RIGHT there. I love that. 

The bathrooms are beautifully decorated ...beautiful I LOVE the copper basins.

The whole place is colorful,extremely inviting and interesting. 

So we walk inside from hot to cool.  We are greeted by a young woman with a beautiful smile and they have a table ready for us (party of 7).  They bring over these hot chips, with warm bean dip AND really delicious salsa.  (This is new, most places offer salsa and chips and that's it right?) 

Then a very nice gentleman asks if we would like drinks YEAH! We order 3 top shelf frozen margaritas (two plain, one mango) and my Mother said it was the best margarita she's ever had...they came out quickly, very well blended and huge (meets all my criteria :-)  

So far ...I AM IN HEAVEN I thought...but then we hear music and there is a male singer who sings a beautiful array of Spanish dinner songs and even one Bossa Nova (EYE EYE YEY) Now I am in heaven.

So we check the menu, very reasonable prices, I ordered the Steak Ranchero medium rare, my Mom ordered SHRIMP Ranchero and there were 5 other orders ...I was a little too busy with my margarita to tell you what they got but I can tell you they were all happy.  We did not have room for dessert this time but I am definitely going back next time I get to Vegas and I will update this report when I do okay? 

The food was fresh, tasty, hot and it came out of the kitchen quickly.  I had to get a to go box and so did my mother.  

They offer hot tortillas, with butter if you ask and the service was oN POINT. Friendly, polite, sweet and generous. My mother said she loved that place and believe me ...she is usually a ...well... a mother. 

I have not felt as if I got MORE than my money's worth in quite a long time but (well technically since I didn't pay ...oh you get the picture) 

Very very good find, thanks yelp, thanks everyone who rated this restaurant because you all helped make a great evening possible for my family.  My mother has been ill and we thought this trip would cheer her up and she loved this place so much, we all did. 

Now you go and eat there and bring your family and friends ( I saw a wedding party y'all) and tell me how you liked it.  I know you are going to be so happy! Go now.

This place was cute, but pretty average.

Our server kept trying to rush us to order because he had a party of 15 he was trying to help as well. We sat down and felt super rushed into ordering he kept saying if we didn't order now the part of 15s order was going to go in before ours and it was going to take way longer to get our food.

The food was nothing spectacular. Tasted like pretty much every other Mexican restaurant I've been to.

We ordered fried ice cream and bananas for dessert and to light them on fire they poured a full shot of tequila over it. All we could taste was tequila it made it pretty much inedible. 

Decent food but nothing I would recommend.
Came here to finish our vegas trip randomly found it on yelp ! Food is so good cant get more authentic . Service js great !! Dont forget to check in for your free margarita!
Always good food, and the service is always spot on. Great guacamole made at the table. We have become regulars at this restaurant.

4.5 stars

My family and I were introduced to this place by my in-laws.  They are regulars to this place, and it didn't take us long to see why.  This place has good food and good service.  

The experience is started off with Chips & Salsa AND Bean Dip.  Chips are nice and fresh; not salty.  Salsa is usually good, but I love the bean dip!  The bean dip is excellent when enjoyed with the chips.  It is served warm and just melts in your mouth.  

Our Entrees were just as good.  Some ofthe entrees that we ordered included a Chicken Flautas (my item), Chile Relleno / Beef Taco Combo, Lightly Breaded Thin Slice of Steak served with French Fries, etc.  although I feasted on the chips and bean dip, I was still able to feast on my Chicken Flautas.  They were nice and crispy (not oily) with juicy chicken pieces inside.  We also had the pleasure of ordering a large mango margarita.  Wow, it was definitely LARGE.  We even got to keep the margarita glass (rinsed clean thanks to our server).  

Loved that they sang to my wife in celebration of her birthday!  A churro dessert was served as the birthday dessert.  To top that off, our server even had a shot of Tequila and Sprite to help commemorate the occasion.  

Service was great!  Our server and team (food runners, etc.) did a great job.  

Prices were also not too bad, especially considering we were there for dinner.

Nice authentic feeling environment with a very large menu. I am not sure if i had a bad day but  the service and food were not very good. Tried this restaurant based on Yelp and another persons suggestion. But after eating here it was disappointing. I ate the fajitas and my friend had the Carne asada. Nothing seemed to be very fresh and the vegetables were overcooked. I wasn't expecting to be this disappointed but it really was not what I expected. Overall not great and will not be trying to return anytime soon. Sorry but that is the truth.

Just finished having dinner for the first time at this restaurant after driving by it for so many years!  Well, we could kick ourselves for not stopping in before. 

I ordered the Chile Rellenos Camerones, which were 2 mild green peppers stuffed with shrimp and topped with cheese. They were really tasty and the shrimp tasted fresh and not like they've been sitting in the fridge for a week.  This entree came with tortillas (corn or my choice, flour) freshly made on-site.  Curiously though, as many homemade tortillas I have eaten in my life, these got really stiff, pasty and cracker like once they got cold.

The wife had the Sopes with Carne Asadas which she enjoyed.  Our sons enjoyed a cheese quisadilla and the other, a cheeseburger and fires, which were really good.

All entrees came with a really good fideo soup.  

Service was really good.  The only hiccup came at the end.  At the beginning of the meal (when we were ordering) I presented our 20% off coupon from our local newspaper that was valid Sun-Fri.  Our server told us he would deduct the discount when he brought our bill at the end of the meal and placed the coupon in his shirt pocket.

I made a silent bet with myself that the bill would not reflect the discount because the server was going to worry we would not tip him appropriately.  My wife and I are not those kind of tippers.  If they are good they will always get 20% from us and if there is a discounted amount, they always get the pre-discount amount for a tip, but we know there's a lot of people who don't practice this but to each their own.

Anyways, we finally got the bill adjusted and left, happy.

We'll definitely be returning here and bring out of town family and friends here also, since El Patron closed.  This place is a lot cheaper than Lindo in HD, whose parking lot also sucks!

Best borito in town and there chiros are great not too sweet service here is good too soft drinks are bottomless our drinks never got half way before it was refilled we like coming here for lunch. 
We are going to try there dinner next

Randomly driving off the strip and happen to spot this place. The bean dip tasted just like typical frijoles so i wasn't that impressed, but it was good. I had 3 tacos de chorizo and they were super delicious! The chorizo was piled high on these which was a nice surprise. My plate came with more beans and some rice both good. The sopa de fideo wasn't bad either but I love my mom's better :) the service was awesome. Our waiter was super courteous and came frequently to refill our drinks. The place is very nicely decorated with authentic Mexican decor and the Spanish music (Vicente Fernandez) playing in the background just added more charm and authenticity to this good Mexican restaurant. I'd definitely eat here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

We checked in on yelp for the free margaritas, I was surprised and delighted that they were 2 margaritas on the rocks and not frozen overly sweetened blended margaritas.   This was a perfect way to start our meal,  while we were looking over the menu we were served chips, salsa and beans.   We were starving so that went pretty fast.   We then ordered our entrees,  I ordered the camerones al conac and he ordered camorones dionisio.  We were still hungry after the chips and salsa so we ordered chips and guacamole which they prepare tableside.   (You can definitely tell these servers do the tableside guacamole several times a day) it's nice that they ask if you want all the ingrediants and how spicy you would like your guac.  The guacamole was nice and refreshing with our margaritas.   Then our soup came.   The fideo soup was a small cup of tomatoey brothey noodle goodness,  I finished every last bite.  When our entrees came out, we both finished everything off our plates,  shrimp,  tortillas,  rice,  beans and a dallop of guacamole,  everything was good!   I enjoyed everything from the service to the margaritas to the appetizers to the entrees,  by this time we were pretty full so passed in the desserts,  I definitely recommend this place for the service,  atmosphere and food.
I love this place! My favorite dish is Camarones Dionisia! By the way ask for Juan the waiter he's the best!!!

Great food, nice atmo...They always give you more than you can handle. Almost any entree is started w/ soup...Fideo.... I have fond memories with friends at this place...It almost takes me back to the time before I had kids & we could sit at the bar drinking Corona's till they close. 

I have a bad habit of ordering the same thing...
Fajita's... 
I guess 'cause I know thier good & I am a definate creature of habit.
highly recommended I would have given 5 stars but I guess i'm just picky that way.

This place is fantastic. Very Mexican looking, a large restaurant with plenty of seating.

Staff is wonderful and very attentive all the time. They have an extensive menu and their food is really good.

They even make plates that are not listed in the menu. I always get the "Pollo Milanesa".

They have a live band as well.

Their tortillas are so so so fresh and so so so yummy. You can have a soup with your plate as well.

Their prices are great and you get a lot of food. Their chips are really good and they come with salsa and bean dip.

I came here to eat with my family and it was very good. Everything about this place is great. The customer service was good as well. The prices are decent nothing to complain about. I was recommended by a friend and her experience went very well as she had told me. Im looking forward to come back soon and I also recommend this place.

Such great food! I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered. The chilaquiles and chorriqueso are my absolute faves. Only downside is that it's off the strip, but definitely worth the short drive from it.

Absolutely the best Mexican food in Las Vegas!  We always stop here when we are in town and it never disappoints!  Juan has hot to be one of the waiters I've ever had.  Upbeat and fun!  Great food!  All around great time!

Every time I would drive by this restaurant the parking lots always at its max capacity.  So finally on a slower day I decided to give it a try :P

The ambience was highly energetic.  All the coworkers  gathered and sang two different birthdays.  The decor was very colorful and gave the Spanish vibe.

As I looked their menu I was getting pretty  full eating their complimentary snack- chip and dips.  They had bean, salsa and guacamole (this was extra $8)  :P  what was so awesome, was how they made the guacamole right in front of us!  Two whole avocados and get to tell them how spicy you like it.  Then they also give this comp soup cup - chicken/tomato I think ? It was pretty delicious. 

Their cilantro steak ($16) was very tender - I ordered the steak medium rare.  They had 
Green sauce with sautéed onions on top of the steak.  It came as a combo - with rice and beans.  

I also tried their chilé relleño burrito ($8.95).  I wasn't too impressed with it.  This is what I would order at any other Mexican fast food chains, but this restaurant made it like an enchilada style - with tomato salsa over it.  
Maybe next time I'll tell them just like a regular burrito with beans and rice inside the burrito and no sauce on top :P

Typical Mexican fare and atmosphere. The margaritas were refreshing. Service was good and attentive.
The table side guacamole is always fun and tasty. I liked the chili Verde. 
Overall, it was all good; just nothing different that most other "good" Mexican restaurants.
If you're looking for a solidly good meal, this will meet your needs. If you're expecting anything more than typical Mexican fare, I'm not sure you'll be happy.

Well....out of all the Michoacan family of restaurants, I would rank this my #3 choice, with Viva being #1 and Lindo being #2.

There's a couple of reasons for this -

1.) Viva gives you complimentary fideo soup when requested. If it doesn't come with an entree, Bonito charges you $2.50 for it. It's good soup but not worth paying $2.50 when it costs probably $.25/cup to make. 
2.) The customer service is off par from the rest. I experienced a rude, short tempered server today at lunch. When I advised my meal came out wrong, he refuted "well this is the way you told me you wanted it!". Well, actually that's not the way I told you and I wouldn't be telling you it was wrong if you just listened the first time. My last visit, when I asked the question "what is fundido dip?" I was treated like I was stupid for not knowing. It was off putting.
3.) The busser was kind but she was bad at refilling drinks. My one pet peeve is drink refills. Don't keep me hanging....
4.) The chips and bean dip that come out are bland. Do they use different chips & dip than the other Michoacan resturants? I'm not certain but they don't taste as good here. 

There are good things about the resturant as well - 

1.) They have an extensive Mexican themed menu with many options for even the pickest of eaters. My favorites are the beef chimichangas and the beef flour flautas. Their spanish rice is decent and their refried beans are good & consistent. I tried my friends carne asada steak today and it was juicy and yummy. Their homemade flour tortillas are delish!
2.) They run resonably priced lunch specials. For two of us, we escaped at around $20.00...not bad for a sit down lunch. 
3.) It seemed as though before our tushs hit the seats that there were chips and dip on the table. We were immediately asked what we would like to drink. Very speedy in this regard.
4.) Pleasant hostess staff, large restaurant seating areas and a full service bar.

In town with the family, we choose to eat out at a Mexican Restaurant, they being locals and we being from out of town took their word.

This place serves you chips with beans and salsa to start and their re-fried beans are amazing delicious. 
When I ordered my food I had to ask for another side of re-fried beans.

I tried their Green Chicken Enchiladas, the sauce was not spicy at all which is a plus, because if the food is too spicy where you can't even enjoy it that's not a good experience.

I got 2 enchiladas with rice and beans and that was enough to fill me up, I wasn't left hungry or over full either.

My family members ate the Shrimp Ceviche Tostadas, I tried one of these and they were amazing.

This place was a good pick, they had music, great tasting food, the price was right, the atmosphere was nice and the servers were very fast and nice.

Second time here and it was just as good as the last time. We arrived Saturday night @730pm. It was packed but we were able to get a table right away. The hostess was friendly and was able to get us regular table instead of a booth by a very loud party. Our water and chips were almost immediately served. The salsa was hot......ouch, but not for my partner who devoured the bowl!  Seconds followed and so did our waiter to take our drink order. I had a mojeto.........pardon my spelling. It was tall, cool and refreshing. This was laden mint leaves and plenty of alcohol.
While waited for food, a DJ played some funky 70s tunes with Mexican music, we laughed and thought it was cool.  Our food was good, nothing out of the ordinary...I had the shrimp sautéed in a cream sauce with lots garlic which I love. My partner had the burrito....covered in cheese and sauce......uh interesting since burritos are not covered in either.  It looked more like a huge enchilada.  The overall service and atmosphere was great. The food, good....but not exceptional.  We will go back.

Pattern of sadness: BIG Mexican restaurant = BAD tacos. "No rice en beans por jur tacos??" 

My eyebrows grimaced at the waiter with a silent OH HELL NO. Whoops, I've become such a taco-snob. "No thanks", I replied more politely. "But can I please get onions, cilantro, and salsa for them?" 

At that he half-grimaced back at me with a silent HUH? "Chure, ob course." ...aaand then they forgot the toppings when my tacos came out... 

2   S T A R S

* FOUND THE TACO GEM!
Never fails -- every place has an unexpected taco-gem. The joy of a Taco Flight is that sweet moment of discovering the stand-out. "JUREKA!"
:::: Raja Con Crema Taco -- MEXCELLENT! Slices of poblano peppers and steak bathed in a creamy mushroom sauce, and served in a fresh tortilla. Every bite was moist and delicious!! 
:::: Fried Fish Taco -- DECENT. Crispy and fresh. Toppings could have been better, but nonetheless it elicited happiness.
:::: Fresh Tortillas -- WOOT!
:::: Consomme -- DECENT. Starter soup with tiny noodles.

* BIG, FESTIVE JOINT
Bonito Michoacan is the prototypical, fun-for-the-whole-family, Mexican-American restaurant. It's got the hostess in bright, ethnic dress, southwestern colors and faux-adobe walls, mariachis selling songs, a photographer selling photos of the dining parties. No cheesy sombreros, so a little dignity is preserved.

3   M I N U S E S

- TERRIBLE MEATS
:::: Carnitas Taco -- MEH! Soo dry! They forgot the toppings. SKIP!
:::: Asada Taco -- BLEH! Flavorless beef. Basically inedible. SKIP!!
:::: Steak Picado -- TRASH! My buddy's steak was just disgusting. Dry, worst cut of the cow, tasted like meat-cardboard.
:::: Rice -- AVERAGE.

- EXPENSIVE!!
Dude! $28 for 2 average margaritas?? $18 for a plate of STEAK TRAGEDY??

- DISCRIMINATION?
My dining buddy watched the restaurant photographer go from table to table, taking nice pics of the customers and offering to sell them prints. Our table, which featured the only Black man in the restaurant (not me), was ignored. Hmm... The photographer came back a few minutes later and skipped us again. Coulda been nothing, but the double cold-shoulder left a taste in our mouths almost as bad as the Steak Picado.

Came here for a family gathering. Unfortunately, there are no real vegan options. Even the beans are made with dairy. The rest of the family seemed to enjoy the food, but vegans should come prepared to starve.

What 4 stars overall really? This place is way better then Lindo There service is amazing I never had a to call the waiter our food was delicious. Venue is great. Overall it was AMAZING!!!!! Ever since Viva closed this has been the new to go restaurant.

The service is always great, even when they have a packed house. They also offer a good selection of vegetarian options. The alcoholic drinks are nice and the tortillas are a must try! This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.
Great food and fun atmosphere. If you enjoy good Mexican food in a nice setting please check this place out.

I was visiting my sister and family in whittier ca and decided to go to Las Vegas for the weekend. We were looking for a good mexican restaurant and asked when stopped for gas. Thank God they gave directions to this place. Being from San Antonio tx I like tex mex food. Was this a pleasant surprise as soon as we walked in. I really liked the sopa de fideo to start with. Then the chips with salsa and very good re fried beans in a small bowl. Settled on chicken enchiladas with white sauce . Must not have liked it because I don't remember it being very good. Service was great. Ordered guacamole and they fixed it at the table for you. Very good. Was not crowded since it was Sunday before noon. Did not like being in a cramp place. There were five of us. Also used the womens bathroom they ran out of paper towels. Told waitress and a very nice lady and gentleman talking to her offered me their napkins. Waitress didn't know what to do.we were there in April. But overall the food was very good. I will go back next time in Vegas.we had been looking for a good place every time we are there.
The menu is amazing. I can't wait to come back so I can try everything. I had the ceviche and fish taco. Everything was delicious! Great service too!

One of my favorite vegas places. Giant margaritas, crazy clown decorations, live music, wacky servers. If you are looking for fancy Mexican food this is not the place for you. I always bring out of town guests here for food and fun. Once the server got up on the booth behind us and danced as he made guacamole ha! The food is good and the menu has lots of choices so you are sure to find something you like. Even though its casual the service is always great. Refill waters BOOM, refill chips BOOM. Birthdays are hilarious, they come out and sing to you and put a sombrero on you haha. It's fun and funky familiar Mexican fair.
My favorite mexican restaurant in town! Always delishious, I come here when I want hearty comfort food.
Foos is great but service from the hostess could be much better. Get rid of the two gals at the front and then maybe 5 stars. They are rude, not welcoming and careless

This is a solid place for Mexican. The food is usually amazing. I did have to send something back once, but they graciously and quickly made me something else that was fabulous.  Great service!  Great prices! Great food!  I do recommend!

Nice people helpful. But the food I ordered was very very bad!!! I ordered some asada tacos, I didn't even eat them. they were full of oil and it didn't taste nor it looked like carne asada. Very disappointing. I have to say their free margarita was very good and their chips with salsa and bean deep was good. But I wouldn't go there just for margaritas and chips with salsa and beans
Food is fabulous as always but the day I decide to bring my family the service was real slow. While others were getting served right away.

The service here is probably the most noteworthy, fun and relaxed- and ultra attentive. Everyone in my group seemed to enjoy their food- 

For my Chile verde I substituted Lengua, and it was great. Their Utra Margarita is awesome though! 6 shots in a huge margarita glass you get to take home afterward. I can't belive I got through the whole thing! My fiance tried some of their cocktails which were just- eh, nothing special. 
Go for the Tequila Margaritas you GRINGOS!

This is a fun place for classic mexican dishes. Ole!

Wonderfully authentic Mexican food! The best server is Richard, go in and ask for him. He is very knowledgeable, funny, enthusiastic and makes your dining experience even better. Nice live music, great family feel. The food is delicious, you will be coming back!

Atmosphere is Very pleasant, the service is very good. Menudo homemade and is very tasty, enchiladas are all very good, the bean dip is tasty with the salsa which is brought to every table. The avocado dip know as guacamole is very tasty but very high in calories. The cactus appetizer is very yummy served with either homemade flour or corn tortillas.  We first learn of this location on Cico De Mayo and have been back several times. One thing I must insist that you do not order are the tacos unless you want to become very disappointed like I did after ordering myself and my date at lunch a la carte two tacos and tostada de ceviche. Only the tacos were very small and fried with maybe a tablespoon and half of chicken and cheese combined and served over shredded lettuce.  These taco's looked like something you would generally avoid at Jack In-Box.
We are from the Rio Grande Valley  on the border of Mexico and this was the most authentic food  I have ever had.  Fantastic  service  really cute waitresses, and  very cold beer.  Well done

Homemade tortillas are sooo good. Get the fundido, it's in the classic style. 

I grew up in So Cal, and it's really hard to find good Mexican food around vegas (at least to meet my standards!) This place does not disappoint.
Cozy atmosphere and great food. Get out of the casino and go eat authentic Mexican food. We took uber from Caesar Palace and with food was cheaper then one dinner at casino. Highly recommend!!

Tasty margaritas that come in giant sizes.  Not only do you get the standard chips and salsa but a really yummy bean dip too.  Friendly, if a bit over the top service.  A gargantuan menu.  I think this place is a solid hit with tons of Mexican standards.  Even though my carnitas weren't the best I've ever had, some of the other dishes were delish.  I'd eat here again.  Three plus plus stars.
Hands down best Mexican in Las Vegas! Food & service is always great. Staff is super happy & on point. Everything is delicious! No complaints!

It was really good. The service is excellent and it has some pretty cool ornaments; nice ambiance. We had the carne asada plate which was delicious. My gf had the menudowhich was not bad, just a bit too much fat on the menudo. 
The bring you chips, salsa and frijolitos mmmmm really good! It could use a bit more lighting in some areas.  They got this old guy playing music  from back in days.... de la era del caldo lol.
This was an amazing meal... The Mole was killer. Service excellent. We're from out of town, always willing to try new places, this did not disappoint.

Bonito Michoacan is one of the more authentic Mexican restaurants I have been to in Las Vegas. Even the funky decor is pretty damn authentic! 

The complementary chips, salsa and bean dip are excellent, we always end up getting more because of how quickly they disappear. Rarely do we have to ask for more chips, salsa or anything for that matter since service is always very attentive... 

I tend to stick to 'standard' dishes when I eat here... they have great tacos, excellent fideo soup, wonderful enchiladas and the strawberry margaritas are made with real fruit, yum! They make their guacamole table-side here, you can request it as mild or as spicy as you prefer.  Prices are reasonable for the large portions you get... 

This isn't your on the strip, "fine dining", spending $50 a plate, fancy dancy type restaurant but it's still well worth a stop even for a special occasion like a birthday... The employees come out singing, with musical instruments and a big sombrero for the special person to wear. I think you get a complimentary dessert as well... It's embarrassing if it's your birthday, hilarious if you are with the birthday boy/girl and entertaining if you just happen to be there when it happens.

My family and I absolutely love Mexican food and this is a great spot we've been coming to for years! The margaritas are very delicious and the food is quite traditional!The staff is very attentive and I look forward to coming back very soon!

I cannot believe I have not yet Yelped that Bonito Michoacan es muy bueno! I've eaten here several times with friends when I visit Vegas, but this time brought family here! I know they thought I was crazy leaving the strip, but I told them it was well worth the short trip! Two family members are Mexican and took a long time to study the menu. They are both from California and have never seen some of these entrees on a menu except in Mexico!

The complimentary bean dip is good and the tableside, fresh-made guacamole is the best! My niece does not usually eat guacamole and she loved it here! I've had some of the lengua dishes before and they are the best I've had! This trip I had the Biria de Chivo (a type of goat soup). I have not had goat since I was in Greece in the 90's and this was so tasty and tender with excellent spice. My only issue is that I did not have room for more! Oh, and let's not forget the margaritas! They actually make them with tequila...good and strong...wink, wink. Fantastico!

If you want to enjoy REAL Mexican food at a fraction of the price of restaurants on the strip, then this is the place! Great food, great service, great prices and more money for Blackjack!

Love the fish in a foil! 
Ask for Richard, he's the bomb! 
Oh and try the top shelf margarita....
I used to love coming here! It was my family's place to always go out to eat but recently, the last couple of times I've gone have not been to great.

Food was great. Had steak and shrimp combo. Servcie was outstanding (Richard). 
Highly recommend.

This place have really good & authentic mexican food!! I try a lot of food there and all good!! The ambience make you feel you are not in America but Feel like you are in mexico.. And they have good horchata drink as well.. All the employees are so welcome and nice. Love it!! Love it!!

Very expensive...but way worth the high prices because the all male staff is the greatest best courteous kind waiters in Vegas....a lot of the food comes out Luke-warm. Refried beans and the rice came out Cold...and the Fideo soup came out cold also...but waiters are so apologetic

This definitely is one of Las Vegas best Mexican restaurants. From the decor to the service and the food, it all deserves 5+ stars. We found this place on Yelp and with all the great reviews everyone left we had to try it. The restaurant was as good or even better then everyone said it would be. We were greeted as soon as we walked in and seated right away. Our server came right out with chips salsa and beans to dip. After looking at the menu for a few minutes our server took our order and the food came right out. Everything everyone ordered looked and tasted great! We told our server it was one of our friends BDay and the whole restaurant came out and sang 2 songs to her! One in English and one in Spanish lol its was soo cool! They even gave her chooros topped with whipped cream lol we had a great time here and id recommend everyone who is looking for good food and great service to come here. You wont regret it!

Just all around delicious authentic Mexican food with authentic atmosphere. Manager came out and let us utilize the free margarita from Yelp. Hostess was beautiful and helpful. Waiter was fast and always on top of everything. Salsa was good. Shrimp tacos were bomb. Cheesecake burrito was a new dessert worth trying. Just go, no way to be disappointed.

Went here for lunch with my co-workers and it was a great experience. The food is phenomenal and the service is top notch. We will definitely be returning for lunch and I plan to bring my family in for dinner some time as well. Definitely worth a visit!
The service here is just excellent! Fast and efficient.. the food was a little bland but the service makes up for it.. glad we stopped by before our drive back to Cali. Totally worth it!

I've been to many different locations from Viva Zapatas to the Michoacana the food here has always been good for me and I highly recommend this place to anyone that wants to have that authentic Mexican food taste service is amazing and the atmosphere is extremely relaxing they have live music and they give free soup tortilla chips salsa and beans I give this place 5 stars because I've been coming here for years and every time they live up to them stars so if you're out looking for a good authentic Mexican place to eat choose this place

Bomb! Bomb! Bomb! I love everything about this place. 
1. Service is great
2. Food is as authentic Mexican and delicious 
3. Price is very reasonable.

Micheladas are the reason we first went here and they did not disappoint they are delicious with the Perfect amount of spice and lemon. Table side guacamole is always a must. The aguachile extra spicey was so fresh and delicious,everything just perfect. It's a must go to place whenever I'm in Vegas.

Great place for vegetarians. Started off with their complementary nachos, hot salsa and crushed beans. It was perfect! Veggie enchiladas and veggie fajitas for dinner. Went well with a glass of their house Merlot. Great and friendly staff. We will be recommending to friends and family.

Came here after recommendation from others as well as seeing the reviews on Yelp.

First off, the starter chips and refried beans/salsa are great. They come quickly, taste fantastic, and are plentiful.

Service is also great - I found it hard to reach the bottom of my glass before refills, waiters were (sincerely) friendly, etc.

Soon after ordering they brought an appetizer of spaghetti soup(?) which was way too salty for my taste.

I had ordered the fajita, which was just okay. The beans/rice/guac that came with were high quality but pretty sparse. It came with some pretty amazing flour tortillas though, which really carried the meal.

Flan topped off my lunch here for dessert. It was definitely too sweet and soft for my taste, but was edible.

Yes! Yes! Yes! Si! Si! Si! I put hot sauce on my burrito babay!!! Make sure you try the fresh made guacamole! Can't go wrong with anything you try but if your unsure. Ask your friendly server and they will certainly lead you to a tasty choice!

This was our second time coming. I was so disappointed on the service. I was so sad I brought my parents with me. There was so much mis communication between the staff. I should have left it with our amazing first experience last year.
Good place to eat good decor and good food and drink. Chili verde was good Cadillac margarita was good.. Nice service guac made fresh bean dip was good I'll definitely go again when I'm in the area

Very good food ,the fideo was delicious . Had a party of 8 ,would have been nice to have more chips and bean dip than the 2 small bowls. Definitely will come back when in Las Vegas again. Prices are very reasonable .

My lunch was delicious! The service was fast, our waiter Julio was very courteous, and the rest rooms were clean. I recommend this place for people who are looking for something off the strip when visiting Vegas.

Love this place the servers are always attentive. And make the dinning a welcome adventure, always great. Hoodie for authentic Mexican flavor! Margaritas spot on.. steak salad has been the best I've had in a long time. Thumbs up!!

We're out-of-towners and came here on a recommendation from friends that frequently come here. They also recommended we try the Playa La Llorona (seafood platter). This dish is full of flavor, very tasty. There were various shrimp prepared differently. The crab legs were also tasty. The rice served in the platter was my favorite with a flavorful sauce that included fish and squid -- yummy!! Violeta, our server, was very gracious and friendly. Would definitely recommend this place and come back next time we're in town.

My family and I went to this restaurant on Mother's Day so perhaps I am being biased as I know most restaurants are out of control on that particular date.

This was my experience: We had a group of 9 and got seated right away. That was initially impressive! Our waiter was a man named Lorenzo. We ordered drinks, got our chips and salsa/bean dip rather quickly. We ordered our food and from then on it was a 45+  minute wait to receive the food. I think I would have been okay with waiting on the food if I didn't notice that all other families that arrived after mine were brought their food right away. Small or larger groups everyone else's waiters were ON IT; however, ours was not. I finally could not stand it any longer and approached him to ask if he could bring our food as each plate was ready, versus waiting on all of them to be ready entirely. He seemed annoyed at my comment, but noticing how slow he was moving kept irritating me.

Once the food arrived, I was starved and shoved everything down. I had a combination plate with Huevos Rancheros. The hand made tortillas that came with the meal were a nice surprise. However, the rice was bland. My huevos rancheros had a weak red sauce with no flavor. I asked around the table, and the variety on our table had burritos and fish combo plates, yet they all agreed that each item was rather bland. 

The alcoholic drink selection although not that large, was very good. I ordered something called "Que Viva la Borrachera" and I have to say that probably saved this entire rating. They packed on the alcohol!

I would consider this place for appetizers and drinks with a friend, but not for a meal.

Food is great and service is fast!!Awesome guacamole made to order tableside!!! 
Chips with salsa and beans are complimentary!!!

Okay I have been putting off this review for almost 2 weeks but I've finally got the time to explain why my rating for this place is only 3 stars! I came here with a co worker on a lunch break a little over a week ago. Greeting from the hostess was pleasant as well as the customer service from our waiter! Good we ordered was the tacos lengua(cow tongue) and my fish tacos! Everything tastes okay UNTIL I went to go eat my last tacos and noticed a baby ant hop off my plate O_o yeah and we all know ants just don't roll solo now do they? Know what this means right? There's clearly more and to what wasn't a surprise I glance over at the window seal and it's plenty more under this vase! YUCK! We immediately got our server who apologized and told us this wasn't likely well we decided to kill one of them and save it in a napkin for management and surely she came out thinking that it couldn't be possible.. She explained that they always clean very good.. Well apparently not because these ants been shacking up for a while. She apologized and gave us HALF off our bill which actually should've been completely comp'd and maybe even a gift certificate to try them again. After being grossed out I didn't even want a to-go box..not sure if i would've wanted anymore ants to bring home (a lot of pun intended)..

I went with a friend because I was really craving tacos and margaritas. I think we went on a Saturday night around 10pm. There was no wait. 

The tacos were really good. The margarita with the 7oz corona with it was amazing! I seriously couldn't love the taste of it more! I definitely want to come back here again. The staff was also friendly.

Delicious chicken fajitas, fresh and tasty shrimp ceviche. Very attentive staff, from the bus boys,expo and server great guys. Bomb fideo soup, reminds me of grandma cooking that .Cannot wait to go back
The service was really great, the atmosphere was incredibly authentic. The food was delicious. I would definitely come here time and time again. It also was really good for a larger group.

Food is good generous portions.  The acoustics in the restaurant are punishing, bordering on painful.
Impossible to hear your waiter or dining companions.

Even though my husband and I have been here several times because it's the closest mexican restaurant to where we live...I will still give it 3 stars. Out of the about 6 or 7 times we've been there, food is always GREAT and Fresh...but unfortunately, we've never had great service. Either something is forgotten, they don't come around often enough to check on us, they bring out the wrong order, etc. I hate to only give this location 3 stars because the food is so good...but as far as the overall experience, I hate feeling "forgotten about" or a "burden" because I ask for a refill on my drink, then have to wait for 15 min to get it. : /
